  4771                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4772                                  
  4773                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4774                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4775                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4776                                  
  4777                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4778                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4779                                  		;=============================================================
  4780                                  		;
  4781                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4782                                  		;
  4783                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4784                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4785                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4786                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4787                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4788                                  
  4789                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4790                                  		;=============================================================
  4791                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4792                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4793                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4794                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4795                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4796                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4797                                  		
  4798                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4799                                  		; (from MSLOAD)
  4800                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h, bp = any, ds = previous cs  
  4801                                  		
  4802 0000162C FA                      		cli
  4803                                  
  4804                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4805                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4806                                  		;push	ax
  4807                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4808                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4809                                  		;pop	ax
  4810                                  	
  4811                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4812                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4813                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4814                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4815                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4816                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4817                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4818                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4819                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4820                                  
  4821                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4822                                  
  4823                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4824                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4825                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4826                                  
  4827 0000162D 2EA3[8815]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4828 00001631 2E891E[8615]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4829                                  
  4830                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4831                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4832                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4833                                  
  4834 00001636 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4835 00001637 07                      		pop	es
  4836 00001638 51                      		push	cx
  4837 00001639 57                      		push	di
  4838                                  
  4839                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4840                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4841                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4842                                  		; ds = cs
  4843 0000163A 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4844 0000163C 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4845                                  		; ds = 0
  4846                                  
  4847 0000163E B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4848                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4849                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4850                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4851 00001640 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4852                                  next_int_:		
  4853 00001643 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4854 00001644 AC                      		lodsb		
  4855                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4856 00001645 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4857 00001646 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4858 00001648 D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4859 0000164A 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4860 0000164C 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4861                                  					; saving address in di
  4862                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4863                                  		;stosw
  4864                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4865                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4866                                  		; 28/09/2023
  4867 0000164E A5                      		movsw
  4868 0000164F A5                      		movsw
  4869                                  
  4870 00001650 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4871 00001652 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4872 00001654 5F                      		pop	di
  4873 00001655 59                      		pop	cx
  4874                                  
  4875                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4876                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4877                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4878                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4879                                  
  4880                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4881                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4882                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4883                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4884                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4885                                  
  4886                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4887 00001656 C7064C00[4F07]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4888                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4889                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4890 0000165C 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4891                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4892 00001660 C7065400[FE07]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4893                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4894                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4895 00001666 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4896                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4897 0000166A C7066400[BE07]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4898                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4899                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4900 00001670 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4901                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4902                                  
  4903                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4904 00001674 0E                      		push	cs
  4905 00001675 1F                      		pop	ds
  4906                                  		
  4907 00001676 A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4908 00001679 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4909 0000167C A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4910 0000167F A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4911                                  					; ;
  4912 00001682 FB                      		sti
  4913 00001683 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4914                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4915                                  
  4916                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4917                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4918                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4919                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4920                                  ;
  4921                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4922                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4923                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4924                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4925                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4926                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4927                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4928                                  
  4929                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4930                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4931                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4932                                  ;
  4933                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4934                                  ; to do anything special.
  4935                                  ;
  4936                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4937                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4938                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4939                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4940                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4941                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4942                                  
  4943                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4944 00001685 A801                    		test	al, 1
  4945                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4946 00001687 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4947                                  
  4948                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4949                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4950                                  ;
  4951                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4952                                  ;
  4953                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4954                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4955                                  
  4956 00001689 50                      		push	ax
  4957 0000168A 53                      		push	bx
  4958 0000168B 51                      		push	cx
  4959 0000168C 52                      		push	dx
  4960 0000168D 57                      		push	di
  4961 0000168E 06                      		push	es
  4962 0000168F B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4963 00001691 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4964 00001693 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4965                                  					; DL = drive number
  4966                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4967                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4968                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4969 00001695 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4970                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4971                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4972                                  		; ds = cs
  4973 00001697 8816[2B16]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4974                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4975 0000169B 07                      		pop	es
  4976 0000169C 5F                      		pop	di
  4977 0000169D 5A                      		pop	dx
  4978 0000169E 59                      		pop	cx
  4979 0000169F 5B                      		pop	bx
  4980 000016A0 58                      		pop	ax
  4981 000016A1 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4982                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4983                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4984                                  
  4985                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4986                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4987                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4988                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]

  4990 000016A6 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4991 000016A8 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4992                                  
  4993                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4994                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4995 000016AA 48                      		dec	ax
  4996 000016AB EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4997                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4998                                  
  4999                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  5000                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5001 000016AD B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  5002 000016B0 A2[9B15]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  5003                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  5004                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  5005                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  5006 000016B3 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!

  5008                                  
  5009                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.

  5012                                  got_num_flp_drvs:

  5014                                  		; 18/12/2022

  5017 000016BD 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system

  5026                                  					; booted off hard file

  5305 000017EE 7605                    		jbe	short resetintf

  5318                                  
  5319                                  ; (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM, 1991)
  5320                                  ;
  5321                                  ; we will check if the system has ibm extended keyboard by
  5322                                  ; looking at a byte at 40:96. if bit 4 is set, then extended keyboard
  5323                                  ; is installed, and we are going to set keyrd_func to 10h, keysts_func to 11h
  5324                                  ; for the extended keyboard function. use cx as the temporary register.
  5325                                  
  5326                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5327                                  		; ds = 0, cx = 0
  5328                                  		;xor	cx, cx

  5408                                  ;
  5409                                  ;   dl - physical drive
  5410                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds

  5423                                  					; to set aside two bdss	for the	two fake floppy	drives
  5424                                  
  5425                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

  5427                                  
  5428                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5429                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5430                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5431                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5432                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5433                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5434                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise

  5729                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5730                                  ; if more than 2 diskette drives on the system, then it is necessary to remap
  5731                                  ; the bds chain to adjust the logical drive num (drive letter) with greater
  5732                                  ; than two diskette drives
  5733                                  ;
  5734                                  ; new scheme:	if more than 2 disktte drives, first map the bds structure
  5735                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5736                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5737                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5738                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5739                                  ;		drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5740                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5741

  5743                                  		;jbe	short static_configure ; no - no need for remapping

  5750                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5751                                  
  5752                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5753                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5754                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5755                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5756                                  ;
  5757                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5758                                  ;
  5759                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5760                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5761                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5762                                  ;use to start with.
  5763                                  ;
  5764                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5765                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5766                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5767                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5768                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5769                                  
  5770                                  ; -- begin changed section
  5771                                  ;
  5772                                  ;   1.	 basic configuration for msbio (endfloppy)
  5773                                  ;   2.   end96tpi	; a system that supports "change line error"
  5774                                  ;   3.	 end of bdss	; end of bdss for hard disks
  5775                                  ;   4.	 endatrom	;some of at rom fix module.
  5776                                  ;   5.	 endcmosclockset;supporting program for cmos clock write.
  5777                                  ;   6.	 endk09 	;k09 cmos clock module to handle suspend/resume operation.
  5778                                  ;
  5779                                  
  5780                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS v5.0 IO.SYS)
  5781

  5839                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5840                                  ;
  5841                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5842                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5843                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5844                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5845                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5846                                  ; off of it.
  5847                                  ;
  5848                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5849                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5850                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5851                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5852                                  ; when to install the hook.

  6153                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  6154                                  
  6155                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6156                                  ; module name: remap
  6157                                  ;
  6158                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  6159                                  ;
  6160                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  6161                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  6162                                  ;
  6163                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  6164                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  6165                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  6166                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  6167                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  6168                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  6169                                  
  6170                                  ; input:       none
  6171                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  6172                                  ; exit error:  none
  6173                                  ; called from: msinit
  6174                                  ;
  6175                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  6176                                  ;	  found in the system
  6177                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  6178                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  6179                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  6180                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  6181                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  6182                                  ;
  6183                                  ;******************************************************************************
  6184                                  
  6185                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6186                                  ; 02/10/2022
  6187                                  
  6188                                  remap:		; proc near		
  6189 00001B01 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  6190                                  
  6191                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  6192                                  
  6193                                  drive_loop:				
  6194 00001B06 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6195                                  					; first	hard disk??
  6196 00001B0A 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  6197 00001B0C 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6198                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  6199 00001B0E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  6200 00001B11 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  6201 00001B13 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  6202                                  
  6203                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6204                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  6205                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  6206                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6207                                  
  6208                                  fdrv_found:				
  6209 00001B15 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  6210                                  fdrv_loop:				
  6211 00001B17 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6212                                  					; found	??
  6213 00001B1A 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6214                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  6215                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  6216                                  		; 18/12/2022
  6217 00001B1C 40                      		inc	ax
  6218 00001B1D 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  6219 00001B20 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  6220                                  
  6221                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6222                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  6223                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  6224                                  ; any more.
  6225                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6226                                  
  6227 00001B22 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  6228                                  					; get first bds
  6229 00001B27 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6230                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6231 00001B29 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6232 00001B2E 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6233                                  remap_loop1:				
  6234 00001B31 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6235                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6236 00001B33 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6237 00001B36 FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6238 00001B38 FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  6239 00001B3A 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6240                                  
  6241                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6242                                  
  6243 00001B3C 2EA0[8415]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6244 00001B40 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6245 00001B42 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6246 00001B44 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  6247 00001B49 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6248                                  
  6249                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6250                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6251                                  
  6252 00001B4B 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6253 00001B4D EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6254                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6255                                  
  6256                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6257                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6258                                  
  6259                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  6260 00001B4F 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6261                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6262 00001B54 2EA2[8415]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6263 00001B58 FEC0                    		inc	al
  6264 00001B5A 1E                      		push	ds
  6265 00001B5B BF4304                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6266                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6267 00001B5E 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6268 00001B60 A2[9802]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6269                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6270                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6271 00001B63 1F                      		pop	ds
  6272                                  rmap_exit:				
  6273 00001B64 C3                      		retn
  6274                                  
  6275                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6276                                  
  6277                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6278                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6279                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6280                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6281                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6282                                  ;**************************************************
  6283                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6284                                  ;
  6285                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6286                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6287                                  ;
  6288                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6289                                  ;**************************************************
  6290                                  
  6291                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6292                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6293                                  
  6294                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  6295                                  		
  6296                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6297                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6298                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6299                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6300                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6301                                  
  6302 00001B65 2EA1[8F15]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6303 00001B69 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6304                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6305 00001B6B BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6306                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6307                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6308 00001B6E B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6309 00001B71 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6310 00001B73 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6311 00001B76 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6312                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6313                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6314                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6315 00001B78 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6316                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6317 00001B7A 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6318                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6319                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6320 00001B81 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6321                                  erret:					
  6322 00001B83 F9                      		stc
  6323                                  norm_ret:				
  6324 00001B84 C3                      		retn
  6325                                  
  6326                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6327                                  
  6328                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6329                                  
  6330                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6331                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6332                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6333                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6334                                  ;   determine version number
  6335                                  ;
  6336                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6337                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6338                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6339                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6340                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6341                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6342                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6343                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6344                                  
  6345                                  sethard:	; proc near
  6346                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6347                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA
  6348 00001B85 57                      		push	di
  6349 00001B86 53                      		push	bx
  6350                                  		;push	ds  ; ds = cs = BIOSDATA ; 12/08/2023
  6351 00001B87 06                      		push	es
  6352 00001B88 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6353 00001B8B 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6354 00001B8E 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6355                                  					; fnon_removable
  6356 00001B92 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6357                                  					; ffHardFile
  6358 00001B96 C606[8C15]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6359 00001B9B 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6360 00001B9D 52                      		push	dx
  6361 00001B9E B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6362 00001BA0 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6363                                  					; DL = drive number
  6364                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6365                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6366                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6367 00001BA2 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6368 00001BA4 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6369 00001BA7 5A                      		pop	dx
  6370 00001BA8 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6371 00001BAA 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6372 00001BAD 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6373 00001BB0 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6374 00001BB1 E8B1FF                  		call	getboot
  6375 00001BB4 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6376 00001BB5 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6377 00001BB7 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6378                                  
  6379                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6380                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6381                                  
  6382                                  act_part:
  6383 00001BBA 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6384 00001BBF 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6385 00001BC1 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6386 00001BC5 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6387 00001BC7 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6388 00001BCB 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6389 00001BCD 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6390 00001BD1 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6391                                  got_good_act:				; 11/08/2023
  6392 00001BD3 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6393                                  					; (0 = first primary dos or active partition)
  6394 00001BD5 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6395 00001BD7 FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6396                                  no_act:					
  6397 00001BD9 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6398 00001BDC 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6399                                  					; last entry done?
  6400 00001BE0 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6401 00001BE2 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6402                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6403                                  
  6404                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6405                                  
  6406                                  get_primary:
  6407 00001BE5 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6408 00001BEA 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6409                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6410 00001BEC 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6411 00001BF0 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6412 00001BF2 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6413 00001BF6 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6414 00001BF8 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6415 00001BFC 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6416                                  got_prim:
  6417 00001BFE 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6418 00001C00 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6419 00001C02 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6420                                  not_prim:
  6421 00001C04 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6422 00001C07 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6423 00001C0B 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6424                                  setret:					
  6425 00001C0D F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6426 00001C0E E99A02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6427                                  
  6428                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6429                                  
  6430                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6431                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6432                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6433                                  ;
  6434                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6435                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6436                                  ;  without change.
  6437                                  ;
  6438                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6439                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6440                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6441                                  
  6442                                  set2:		
  6443                                  		; 12/08/2023
  6444                                  		; ds = cs = BIOSDATA segment (0070h)
  6445 00001C11 8816[9115]              		mov	[rom_drv_num], dl
  6446                                  		;mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6447                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6448 00001C15 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6449 00001C19 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6450                                  
  6451                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6452                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6453                                  
  6454 00001C1D 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6455 00001C20 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6456 00001C23 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6457 00001C27 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6458 00001C2B 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6459 00001C2D 800E[8C15]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6460                                  okdrive:
  6461 00001C32 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6462 00001C36 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6463                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6464 00001C39 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6465 00001C3D 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6466 00001C40 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6467 00001C44 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6468 00001C48 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6469 00001C4B 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6470                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6471 00001C4E 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6472 00001C51 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  6473 00001C53 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6474 00001C56 72B5                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6475                                  okdrive_1:
  6476 00001C58 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6477 00001C5B 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6478 00001C5E 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6479                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6480 00001C60 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6481 00001C63 50                      		push	ax
  6482 00001C64 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6483 00001C66 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6484 00001C68 F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6485                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6486                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6487                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6488                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6489 00001C6A A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
  6490 00001C6D 58                      		pop	ax
  6491 00001C6E F7F3                    		div	bx
  6492 00001C70 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6493 00001C72 FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6494 00001C74 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6495 00001C76 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6496 00001C79 50                      		push	ax
  6497 00001C7A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6498                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6499 00001C7C A1[2105]                		mov	ax, [temp_h] ; 12/08/2023
  6500 00001C7F F7F3                    		div	bx
  6501                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6502 00001C81 A3[2105]                		mov	[temp_h], ax ; 12/08/2023
  6503 00001C84 58                      		pop	ax
  6504 00001C85 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6505                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)
  6506 00001C87 833E[2105]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
  6507                                  		;cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6508 00001C8C 775F                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6509 00001C8E 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6510 00001C91 775A                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6511                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6512                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6513                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6514                                  okdrive_2:
  6515                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6516                                  ; dl is head.
  6517                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6518                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6519                                  
  6520                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6521                                  
  6522 00001C93 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6523                                  					; check for mini disk
  6524 00001C97 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  6525 00001C99 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6526                                  					; set the physical track number
  6527                                  oknotmini:
  6528                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6529                                  				
  6530 00001C9C D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two bits of cyl to high
  6531 00001C9E D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6532 00001CA0 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of bits
  6533 00001CA3 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits to correct spot
  6534 00001CA5 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch iscylinder (low 8 bits)
  6535                                  					; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6536 00001CA7 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6537                                  		
  6538                                  		; 12/08/2023 (ds=cs)

  6540                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6541                                  
  6542                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6543                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6544                                  ; dh is head
  6545                                  ; dl is drive
  6546                                  
  6547                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6548                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6549                                  
  6550                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6551                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.

  6553 00001CAD 0E                      		push	cs
  6554 00001CAE 07                      		pop	es
  6555 00001CAF BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6556                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6557                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6558 00001CB2 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6559 00001CB5 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6560                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6561                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6562                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6563                                  
  6564                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6565                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6566                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6567

  6572 00001CB8 50                      		push	ax

  6583 00001CC7 751F                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid bs ; 11/08/2023

  6588                                  					; point to the bpb in the boot record

  6591                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte

  6593 00001CD1 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6594 00001CD3 7513                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no, invalid boot record
  6595                                  		;cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6596 00001CD5 813F0002                		cmp	word [bx], 512 ; 12/08/2023
  6597 00001CD9 750D                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6598                                  
  6599                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6600 00001CDB 8A4702                  		mov	al, [bx+2] ; 12/08/2023
  6601                                  		;mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure that
  6602                                  					; the sectorspercluster is
  6603                                  					; a power of 2
  6604                                  					;
  6605                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6606                                  					; get the sectorspercluster

  6608 00001CE0 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record

  6612 00001CE4 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6613 00001CE6 740B                    		jz	short valid_boot_record

  7080                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is guaranteed
  7081                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  7082                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  7083                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!

  7085 00001E33 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; 12 bit fat (FAT12 fs)

  7100                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

  7102                                  ; for bigfat we do need to extend this logic to 32 bit sector calculation.

  7104                                  dobig:					
  7105 00001E51 B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  7106 00001E53 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)
  7107 00001E54 8B550C                  		mov	dx, [di+0Ch]	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  7108 00001E57 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  7109 00001E59 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
  7110 00001E5B 5A                      		pop	dx
  7111 00001E5C 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= total	sectors	- root dir sectors
  7112 00001E5F 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  7113 00001E62 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= t - r	- d
  7114                                  					; total	secs - reserved	secs - root dir	secs
  7115 00001E65 B302                    		mov	bl, 2

  7117                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  7118                                  
  7119                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  7120                                  
  7121                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  7122                                  		; 27/09/2022
  7123                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  7124                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  7125                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  7126                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  7127                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  7128                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32)
  7129                                  		;   TmpVal2 = TmpVal2 / 2;
  7130                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  7131                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  7132                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32) {
  7133                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = 0;
  7134                                  		;   BPB_FATSz32 = FATSz;
  7135                                  		;} else {
  7136                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz);
  7137                                  		;/* there is no BPB_FATSz32 in a FAT16 BPB */
  7138                                  		;}
  7139                                  					; dx:ax = TmpVal1, bx = TmpVal2
  7140 00001E6A 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; 
  7141 00001E6C 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2
  7142 00001E6F 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		
  7143 00001E72 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2-1
  7144                                  
  7145                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  7146                                  
  7147 00001E75 F7F3                    		div	bx		; BDS.fatsecs =
  7148                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  7149 00001E77 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  7150                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  7151                                  
  7152                                  ; now, set the default filesys_id, volume label, serial number
  7153                                  
  7154                                  		; 05/08/2023
  7155                                  		; [di+1Fh] = [fbigfat]
  7156                                  		;
  7157                                  		;;mov	bl, ds:fbigfat
  7158                                  		;; 17/10/2022

  7184                                  
  7185                                  ; at this point, in bpb of bds table, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS which is
  7186                                  ; set according to the partition information. we are going to
  7187                                  ; see if (hidden sectors + total sectors) > a word. if it is true,
  7188                                  ; then no change. otherwise, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be moved
  7189                                  ; to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be set to 0.
  7190                                  ; we don't do this for the bpb information from the boot record. we

  7253                                  ;fdisk of pc dos 3.3 and below, os2 1.0 has a bug. the maximum number of
  7254                                  ;sector that can be handled by pc dos 3.3 ibmbio should be 0ffffh.
  7255                                  ;instead, sometimes fdisk use 10000h to calculate the maximum number.
  7256                                  ;so, we are going to check that if BPB_TOTALSECTORS + hidden sector = 10000h

  7309 00001EE8 0200                    word2:		dw 2
  7310 00001EEA 0300                    word3:		dw 3
  7311 00001EEC 0002                    word512:	dw 512
  7312                                  
  7313                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7314                                  
  7315                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7316                                  
  7317                                  ; setdrvparms sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the system based on
  7318                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  7319                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same
  7320                                  ; as the bpb on the drive.
  7321                                  ;
  7322                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
  7323                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
  7324                                  
  7325                                  setdrvparms:
  7326 00001EEE 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  7327                                  		; 18/10/2022
  7328 00001EF0 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds in list
  7329                                  _next_bds:				
  7330 00001EF4 06                      		push	es
  7331 00001EF5 57                      		push	di
  7332 00001EF6 268A5D22                		mov	bl, [es:di+22h]	; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
  7333 00001EFA 80FB05                  		cmp	bl, 5		; ffHardFile
  7334 00001EFD 753E                    		jnz	short nothardff
  7335 00001EFF 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7336 00001F01 268B450E                		mov	ax, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
  7337 00001F05 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  7338 00001F07 7508                    		jnz	short get_ccyl
  7339 00001F09 268B551D                		mov	dx, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  7340 00001F0D 268B451B                		mov	ax, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  7341                                  
  7342                                  get_ccyl:				
  7343 00001F11 52                      		push	dx
  7344 00001F12 50                      		push	ax
  7345 00001F13 268B4515                		mov	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
  7346 00001F17 26F76513                		mul	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
  7347                                  					; assume sectors per cyl. < 64k.
  7348 00001F1B 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax		; cx has # sectors per cylinder
  7349 00001F1D 58                      		pop	ax
  7350 00001F1E 5A                      		pop	dx		; dx:ax	= total	sectors
  7351 00001F1F 50                      		push	ax
  7352 00001F20 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  7353 00001F22 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7354 00001F24 F7F1                    		div	cx
  7355 00001F26 2EA3[2105]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax	; ax be	0 here.
  7356 00001F2A 58                      		pop	ax
  7357 00001F2B F7F1                    		div	cx		; div #sec by sec/cyl to get # cyl.
  7358 00001F2D 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
  7359 00001F2F 7401                    		jz	short no_cyl_rnd ; came out even
  7360 00001F31 40                      		inc	ax		; round	up
  7361                                  
  7362                                  no_cyl_rnd:				
  7363 00001F32 26894525                		mov	[es:di+25h], ax	; [es:di+BDS.cylinders]
  7364 00001F36 06                      		push	es
  7365 00001F37 1F                      		pop	ds
  7366 00001F38 8D7506                  		lea	si, [di+6]	; [di+BDS.bytespersec]
  7367                                  					; ds:si	-> bpb for hard	file
  7368 00001F3B EB55                    		jmp	short set_recbpb
  7369                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7370                                  
  7371                                  nothardff:				
  7372 00001F3D 0E                      		push	cs
  7373 00001F3E 1F                      		pop	ds
  7374                                  
  7375                                  ; if fake floppy drive variable is set then we don't have to handle this bds.
  7376                                  ; we can just go and deal with the next bds at label go_to_next_bds.
  7377                                  
  7378                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7379                                  		; ds = cs
  7380                                  		; 17/10/2022 (ds=cs)
  7381 00001F3F 803E[9B15]01            		cmp	byte [fakefloppydrv], 1
  7382                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  7383 00001F44 7454                    		jz	short go_to_next_bds
  7384 00001F46 80FB07                  		cmp	bl, 7		; ffother
  7385                                  					; special case "other" type of medium
  7386 00001F49 753D                    		jnz	short not_process_other
  7387                                  process_other:
  7388 00001F4B 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7389 00001F4D 8B4525                  		mov	ax, [di+25h]	; [di+BDS.cylinders]
  7390 00001F50 F76536                  		mul	word [di+36h]	; [di+BDS.rheads]
  7391 00001F53 F76534                  		mul	word [di+34h]	; [di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
  7392 00001F56 89452F                  		mov	[di+2Fh], ax	; [di+BDS.rtotalsecs16]
  7393                                  					; have the total number of sectors
  7394 00001F59 48                      		dec	ax
  7395 00001F5A B201                    		mov	dl, 1
  7396                                  _again:					
  7397 00001F5C 3DF60F                  		cmp	ax, 0FF6h	; 4096-10
  7398 00001F5F 7206                    		jb	short _@@
  7399 00001F61 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  7400 00001F63 D0E2                    		shl	dl, 1
  7401 00001F65 EBF5                    		jmp	short _again
  7402                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7403                                  
  7404                                  _@@:					
  7405 00001F67 80FA01                  		cmp	dl, 1		; is it	a small	disk ?
  7406 00001F6A 7405                    		jz	short __@@	; yes, 224 root	entries	is enuf
  7407 00001F6C C7452DF000              		mov	word [di+2Dh], 240 ; [di+BDS.rdirentries]
  7408                                  __@@:					
  7409 00001F71 885529                  		mov	[di+29h], dl	; [di+BDS.rsecperclus]
  7410                                  
  7411                                  ; logic to get the sectors/fat area.
  7412                                  ; fat entry is assumed to be 1.5 bytes!!!
  7413                                  
  7414                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7415                                  		; ds = cs
  7416                                  		; 17/10/2022 (ds=cs)
  7417 00001F74 F726[EA1E]              		mul	word [word3]
  7418 00001F78 F736[E81E]              		div	word [word2]
  7419 00001F7C 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7420 00001F7E F736[EC1E]              		div	word [word512]
  7421                                  		;
  7422                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7423                                  		;mul	word [cs:word3]	; * 3 ; mul word [cs:word3]
  7424                                  		;div	word [cs:word2]	; / 2 ; div word [cs:word2]
  7425                                  		;xor	dx, dx
  7426                                  		;div	word [cs:word512] ; / 512 ; div word [cs:word512]
  7427                                  		;
  7428 00001F82 40                      		inc	ax		; + 1
  7429                                  no_round_up:
  7430 00001F83 894532                  		mov	[di+32h], ax	; [di+BDS.rfatsecs]
  7431 00001F86 EB12                    		jmp	short go_to_next_bds
  7432                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7433                                  
  7434                                  not_process_other:			
  7435 00001F88 D1E3                    		shl	bx, 1		; bx is	word index into	table of bpbs
  7436                                  		;mov	si, bpbtable
  7437                                  		;mov	si, [bpbtable+bx] ; 15/10/2022
  7438                                  		; 09/12/2022
  7439                                  		;mov	si, BPBTABLE
  7440                                  		;mov	si, [bx+si]	; get address of bpb
  7441                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7442                                  		;mov	si, [BPBTABLE+bx]
  7443                                  		; 13/12/2022
  7444                                  		;mov	si, [SYSINITOFFSET+bpbtable+bx] ; wrong ! 14/08/2023
  7445                                  		; 14/08/2023
  7446                                  		SYSINIT_OFFSET equ (SYSINITSEG-DOSBIODATASEG<<4)
  7447                                  							; correct offset
  7448 00001F8A 8BB7[0C87]              		mov	si, [bx+SYSINIT_OFFSET+bpbtable]
  7449                                  		
  7450                                  		; 28/08/2023
  7451 00001F8E 81C6303D                		add	si, SYSINIT_OFFSET
  7452                                  set_recbpb:					
  7453 00001F92 8D7D27                  		lea	di, [di+27h]	; [di+BDS.R_BPB]
  7454                                  					; es:di	-> recbpb
  7455 00001F95 B91900                  		mov	cx, 25		; bpbx.size
  7456 00001F98 F3A4                    		rep movsb		; move (size bpbx) bytes	
  7457                                  go_to_next_bds:				
  7458 00001F9A 5F                      		pop	di
  7459 00001F9B 07                      		pop	es		; restore pointer to bds
  7460 00001F9C 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
  7461 00001F9F 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; -1
  7462 00001FA2 740A                    		jz	short got_end_of_bds_chain
  7463 00001FA4 E94DFF                  		jmp	_next_bds
  7464                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7465                                  
  7466                                  		; 18/12/2022
  7467                                  ;got_end_of_bds_chain:			
  7468                                  		;retn
  7469

  7471                                  
  7472                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7473                                  ; 30/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7474                                  
  7475                                  ; al = device number
  7476                                  
  7477                                  print_init:	
  7478 00001FA7 98                      		cbw
  7479 00001FA8 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax
  7480 00001FAA B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  7481 00001FAC CD17                    		int	17h		; PRINTER - INITIALIZE
  7482                                  					; DX = printer port (0-3)
  7483                                  					; Return: AH = status
  7484                                  got_end_of_bds_chain:	; 18/12/2022
  7485 00001FAE C3                      		retn
  7486                                  
  7487                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================

  7495                                  					; 2400,n,1,8 (msequ.inc)

  7497                                  		; 10/12/2022
  7498 00001FB2 B8A300                  		mov	ax, 00A3h
  7499 00001FB5 CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - INITIALIZE USART
  7500                                  					; 	AL = initializing parameters,
  7501                                  					;	DX = port number (0-3)
  7502                                  					; Return: AH = RS-232 status code bits,
  7503                                  					;	  AL = modem status bits
  7504 00001FB7 C3                      		retn
