  9726                                  
  9727                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9728                                  
  9729                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9730                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9731                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9732                                  ;
  9733                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9734                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9735                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9736                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9737                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9738                                  ;
  9739                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9740                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9741                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9742                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9743                                  
  9744                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9745 000004CE E84B00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9746 000004D1 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9747                                  
  9748                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9749                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9750                                  ;
  9751                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9752                                  ;	       ----------------
  9753                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9754                                  ;
  9755                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9756                                  ;
  9757                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9758                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9759                                  ;		1,193,180
  9760                                  ;
  9761                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9762                                  ;
  9763                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9764                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9765                                  ;		59,659
  9766                                  ;
  9767                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9768                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9769                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9770                                  ;
  9771                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9772                                  ; multiply by 5
  9773                                  
  9774 000004D5 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9775 000004D7 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9776                                  					; multiply by 5
  9777 000004D9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9778 000004DB D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9779 000004DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9780 000004DF D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9781 000004E1 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9782 000004E3 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9783 000004E5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9784                                  
  9785                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9786                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9787                                  
  9788 000004E6 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9789 000004E9 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9790                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9791                                  
  9792                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9793                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9794 000004EB 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
  9795 000004EC 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9796 000004EE F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9797                                  
  9798                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9799                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9800                                  
  9801 000004F0 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9802 000004F2 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9803                                  
  9804                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9805                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9806                                  
  9807 000004F5 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9808 000004F7 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9809 000004FA 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9810 000004FC 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9811                                  noadj:					
  9812 000004FF F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9813 00000500 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9814                                  
  9815                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9816                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9817                                  
  9818 00000502 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9819 00000504 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9820 00000506 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9821 00000508 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9822 0000050B F7F1                    		div	cx
  9823 0000050D 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9824 0000050F F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9825 00000511 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9826                                  
  9827                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9828                                  
  9829                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9830                                  		;push	ax
  9831                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9832 00000513 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9833 00000514 AB                      		stosw
  9834                                  		;pop	ax
  9835 00000515 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9836 00000516 AB                      		stosw
  9837 00000517 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9838 00000519 AB                      		stosw
  9839 0000051A F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
  9840                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
  9841                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
  9842                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
  9843                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
  9844 0000051B C3                      		retn
  9845                                  
  9846                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9847                                  
  9848                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9849                                  
  9850                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9851                                  ;
  9852                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9853                                  ;
  9854                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9855                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9856                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9857                                  ;
  9858                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9859                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9860                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9861                                  ;			else
  9862                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9863                                  ;		}
  9864                                  ;
  9865                                  ; USES : AX
  9866                                  ;
  9867                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9868                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9869                                  ;
  9870                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9871                                  
  9872                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9873                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9874 0000051C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9875 0000051E CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9876                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9877                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9878                                  					; midnight
  9879                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9880 00000520 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9881 00000525 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9882 00000527 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9883                                  					; and not flag
  9884 00000529 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9885 0000052D C3                      		retn
  9886                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9887                                  
  9888                                  inc_case:				
  9889 0000052E 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9890 00000530 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9891 00000532 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9892                                  no_rollover:				
  9893 00000536 C3                      		retn
  9894

  9922                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9923                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9924                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9925                                  
  9926                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9927                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9928                                  
  9929                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9930                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9931                                  
  9932                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9933                                  
  9934                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9935                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9936                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9937                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9938                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9939                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9940                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9941                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9942                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9943                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9944                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9945                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9946                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9947                                  
  9948                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9949                                  
  9950                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9951                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9952                                  ;
  9953                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9954                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9955                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9956                                  ;   else
  9957                                  ;	set slow = value
  9958                                  ;   ...
  9959                                  ;*********************************************
  9960                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9961                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9962                                  ;*	 use slow
  9963                                  ;*   else
  9964                                  ;*	 use fast
  9965                                  ;*********************************************
  9966                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9967                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9968                                  ;	use slow
  9969                                  ;   else
  9970                                  ;	use fast
  9971                                  ;   ...
  9972                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9973                                  ;
  9974                                  ;
  9975                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9976                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9977                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9978                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9979                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9980                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9981                                  
  9982                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9983                                  
  9984                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9985                                  
  9986                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9987

  9990                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9991

 10062                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10063                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
 10064                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
 10065                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
 10066                                  ;
 10067                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
 10068                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10069                                  
 10070                                  SetDrive:	
 10071                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
 10072 0000056D C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
 10073                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
 10074 00000571 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
 10075 00000575 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
 10076 00000577 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
 10077 0000057A 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 10078 0000057D 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
 10079 0000057F F9                      		stc
 10080                                  X_SetDrv:				
 10081 00000580 C3                      		retn

 10083                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10084                                  
 10085                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10086                                  
 10087                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 10088                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
 10089                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
 10090                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
 10091                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
 10092                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 10093                                  
 10094                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
 10095 00000581 E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
 10096 00000584 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
 10097 00000587 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10098                                  					; fchanged_by_format
 10099 0000058C 7415                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
 10100                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10101 0000058E 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
 10102                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10103                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
 10104 00000593 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
 10105                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
 10106 00000598 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10107                                  					; fnon_removable
 10108 0000059D 740B                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
 10109                                  		;mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
 10110                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10111 0000059F F7DE                    		neg	si		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05E0h
 10112 000005A1 EB2B                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
 10113                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10114                                  
 10115                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
 10116                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
 10117 000005A3 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10118 000005A8 7524                    		jnz	short Media_Done
 10119                                  wehaveafloppy:				
 10120                                  		;xor	si, si ; 0	; Presume "I don't know"
 10121                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10122 000005AA 4E                      		dec	si ; 0 		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05EBh
 10123                                  
 10124                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
 10125                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
 10126                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
 10127                                  
 10128 000005AB 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
 10129 000005B0 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
 10130 000005B2 E88112                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
 10131 000005B5 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
 10132 000005B7 E8D113                  		call	haschange
 10133 000005BA 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
 10134                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
 10135                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
 10136                                  			
 10137 000005BC BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change

 10139 000005C2 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10140                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
 10141 000005C6 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"

 10150                                  		; Clean up the left overs
 10151                                  Media_Done:	
 10152                                  		; 19/10/2022

 10154 000005CF C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]

 10156 000005D7 07                      		pop	es
 10157 000005D8 09F6                    		or	si, si
 10158 000005DA 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
 10159 000005DC 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 10160 000005E1 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
 10161 000005E3 E83713                  		call	media_set_vid

 10164                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check
 10165                                  ret_carry_clear:

 10170                                  err_exitj:

 10172                                  ret81:

 10174 000005F2 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
 10175                                  
 10176                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10177                                  
 10178                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10179                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
 10180                                  ; drive.
 10181                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
 10182                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
 10183                                  ; returns in si:
 10184                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 10185                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 10186                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 10187                                  ;
 10188                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 10189                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10190                                  
 10191                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10192                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 10193 000005F3 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 10194 000005F6 E823FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 10195 000005F9 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 10196                                  					; get stored time
 10197 000005FD 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 10198 000005FF 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 10199 00000603 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 10200                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10201                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
 10202                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
 10203 00000605 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 10204 00000607 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 10205 00000609 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 10206                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10207                                  		;inc	al
 10208                                  		;cmp	al, 5
 10209                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
 10210                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
 10211                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
 10212                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
 10213                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 10214                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10215                                  		;dec	al
 10216                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 10217                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10218 0000060B 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
 10219 00000610 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
 10220 00000612 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
 10221 00000616 C3                      		retn
 10222                                  
 10223                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10224                                  
 10225                                  timepassed:
 10226 00000617 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
 10227                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
 10228 0000061A 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
 10229                                  
 10230                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
 10231                                  timecheck_unk:				
 10232 0000061C 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
 10233                                  timecheck_ret:
 10234                                  		; 11/08/2023
 10235                                  		;mov	[accesscount], al
 10236 0000061D C3                      		retn
 10237                                  
 10238                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10239                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10240                                  Err_Exitj2:
 10241 0000061E EBCD                    		jmp	short err_exitj

 10248                                  ; Build a valid bpb for the disk in the drive.

 10252                                  get_bpb:				; 2C7h:592h = 70h:2B02h

 10280                                  
 10281                                  ;		 fall into setptrsav, es:di -> result

 10285                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10286                                  
 10287                                  ; ==========================================================================
 10288                                  ;Setptrsav is also jumped to from dsk_init (msbio2.asm). In both cases, the
 10289                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
 10290                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.
 10291                                  ;It fails, for instance, when we install an external drive using driver.sys
 10292                                  ;because then the BDS segment is no longer Bios_Data. 
 10293                                  ;NB: It is fine to corrupt cx because this is not a return value and anyway
 10294                                  ;this returns to Chardev_entry (msbio1.asm) where all registers are 
 10295                                  ;restored before returning to the caller.
 10296                                  ; ==========================================================================

 10401                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10402                                  
 10403                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10404                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10405                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10406                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10407                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10408                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10409                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10410                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10411                                  ;
 10412                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10413                                  ;
 10414                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10415                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10416                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10417                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10418                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10419                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10420                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10421                                  ;
 10422                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10423                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 10424                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 10425                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10426

 10592                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10593                                  
 10594                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10595                                  
 10596                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10597                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10598                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10599                                  ;
 10600                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10601                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10602                                  
 10603                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10604                                  
 10605                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 10606                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
 10607                                  
 10608                                  readbootsec:	
 10609 0000074C B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10610 0000074E B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10611 00000751 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10612 00000754 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10613 00000756 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10614                                  
 10615                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10616                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10617                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10618                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10619                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10620                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10621                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10622                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10623                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10624                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10625                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10626                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10627                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10628                                  		; informations
 10629                                  
 10630                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10631                                  
 10632                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10633                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10634                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10635                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10636                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10637                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10638                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10639                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10640                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10641                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10642                                  
 10643                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10644 00000758 A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10645 0000075B 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10646 0000075D 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10647                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10648 0000075F 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10649 00000761 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10650                                  					; no need for nop
 10651 00000763 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10652 00000765 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10653 00000767 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10654 0000076C 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10655                                  
 10656                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10657                                  ;
 10658                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10659                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10660                                  ;;
 10661                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10662                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10663                                  ;;
 10664                                  ;;check_signature:
 10665                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10666                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10667                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 10668                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10669                                  
 10670                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10671                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10672                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10673                                  
 10674                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10675                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 10676 0000076E A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10677                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10678 00000771 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10679 00000772 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10680 00000774 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10681 00000776 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10682 00000777 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10683                                  
 10684                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10685                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10686                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10687                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10688                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10689                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10690                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10691                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10692                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10693                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10694                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10695                                  
 10696                                  checksinglesided:
 10697                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10698                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10699                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10700 00000779 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10701 0000077B 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10702 0000077D A801                    		test	al, 1
 10703 0000077F 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10704 00000781 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10705 00000787 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10706 00000789 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10707 0000078E 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10708                                  
 10709                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10710                                  
 10711                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10712 00000790 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10713                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10714 00000795 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10715                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10716                                  
 10717                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10718 00000797 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10719                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10720                                  movbpb_ret:
 10721                                  gooddsk:				
 10722 00000798 F8                      		clc
 10723                                  err_ret:
 10724 00000799 C3                      		retn
 10725                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10726                                  
 10727                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10728                                  ;err_ret:				
 10729                                  		;retn
 10730                                  
 10731                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10732                                  
 10733                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10734                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10735                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10736                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10737                                  ;
 10738                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10739                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10740                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10741                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10742                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10743                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10744                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10745                                  
 10746                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10747                                  
 10748                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10749                                  movbpb:	
 10750 0000079A 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10751                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10752                                  					; sectors per unit
 10753 0000079E 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10754                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10755                                  					; number of directory entries
 10756 000007A2 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10757                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10758                                  					; size of drive
 10759 000007A6 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10760                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10761                                  					; media	descriptor
 10762 000007AA A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10763                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10764                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10765 000007AD 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10766                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10767                                  					; sectors per track
 10768 000007B1 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10769                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10770                                  					; number of heads
 10771 000007B5 803E[0205]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10772 000007BA 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10773 000007BC E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10774 000007BF 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10775 000007C1 C606[0205]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10776                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10777 000007C6 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10778 000007CB 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10779 000007CD E8B511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10780                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10781                                  		; cf = 0
 10782                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10783                                  		;clc
 10784 000007D0 C3                      		retn
 10785                                  
 10786                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10787                                  
 10788                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10789                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10790                                  ;by es:di.
 10791                                  
 10792                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10793                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10794                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10795                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10796                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10797                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10798                                  
 10799                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10800                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10801 000007D1 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10802                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10803                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10804 000007D6 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10805 000007D8 51                      		push	cx
 10806 000007D9 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10807                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10808 000007DD 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10809 000007E1 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10810                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10811 000007E5 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10812 000007E9 57                      		push	di
 10813 000007EA 56                      		push	si
 10814 000007EB B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10815 000007EE BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10816                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10817                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10818 000007F1 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10819 000007F4 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10820                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10821                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10822 000007F6 B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10823 000007F8 BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10824                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10825 000007FB 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10826 000007FE F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10827 00000800 5E                      		pop	si
 10828 00000801 5F                      		pop	di
 10829 00000802 59                      		pop	cx
 10830                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10831                                  		; cf = 0
 10832                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10833                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 10834 00000803 C3                      		retn

 10836

 10838 00000804 F9                      		stc

 10842                                  
 10843                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10844                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10845                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10846                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10847                                  ; output:
 10848                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10849                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10850                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10851                                  
 10852                                  readfat:	
 10853                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10854                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10855 00000806 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10856 00000808 B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10857                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10858 0000080B E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10859 0000080E 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10860 00000810 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10861                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10862 00000812 C3                      		retn
 10863                                  
 10864                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10865                                  
 10866                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10867                                  
 10868                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10869                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10870                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10871                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10872                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10873                                  ;		dh has head
 10874                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10875                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10876                                  ;
 10877                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10878                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10879                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10880                                  ;
 10881                                  ;		carry set
 10882                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10883                                  ;
 10884                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10885                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10886                                  
 10887                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10888                                  
 10889                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10890                                  read_sector:	
 10891 00000813 55                      		push	bp
 10892 00000814 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10893 00000817 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10894 0000081B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10895                                  rd_ret:					
 10896 0000081E 06                      		push	es
 10897 0000081F 1E                      		push	ds
 10898 00000820 07                      		pop	es
 10899 00000821 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10900 00000824 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10901                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10902                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10903                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10904 00000826 07                      		pop	es
 10905 00000827 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10906                                  rd_rty:					
 10907 00000829 E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10908 0000082C 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10909 0000082E 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10910                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10911                                  					; fnon_removable
 10912 00000833 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10913 00000835 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10914 0000083A 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10915 0000083C 50                      		push	ax
 10916 0000083D 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10917 0000083E C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10918                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10919                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10920                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10921                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10922 00000842 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10923 00000844 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10924                                  		; 
 10925 00000847 1F                      		pop	ds
 10926 00000848 A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10927 0000084B 58                      		pop	ax
 10928                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10929 0000084C 06                      		push	es
 10930 0000084D 1E                      		push	ds
 10931 0000084E 07                      		pop	es
 10932 0000084F B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10933 00000852 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10934                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10935                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10936                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10937 00000854 07                      		pop	es
 10938 00000855 9C                      		pushf
 10939 00000856 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10940 0000085B 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10941 0000085D 50                      		push	ax
 10942 0000085E A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10943 00000861 1E                      		push	ds
 10944 00000862 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10945 00000866 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10946 00000869 1F                      		pop	ds
 10947 0000086A 58                      		pop	ax
 10948                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10949 0000086B 9D                      		popf
 10950 0000086C 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10951 0000086E EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10952                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10953                                  
 10954                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10955 00000870 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10956                                  					; return error
 10957 00000872 F9                      		stc
 10958                                  
 10959                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10960                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10961                                  
 10962                                  okret2:					
 10963 00000873 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10964 00000877 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed

 10971 00000884 5D                      		pop	bp

 11065                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11066                                  
 11067                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 11068                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 11069                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 11070                                  
 11071                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 11072                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 11073                                  ;
 11074                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 11075                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 11076                                  
 11077                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11078                                  checksingle:		
 11079 000008D5 50                      		push	ax
 11080 000008D6 53                      		push	bx
 11081 000008D7 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11082                                  
 11083                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 11084                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 11085                                  
 11086 000008DB F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 11087 000008DE 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 11088 000008E0 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 11089                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 11090 000008E3 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 11091                                  
 11092                                  
 11093                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 11094                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 11095                                  
 11096 000008E5 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 11097                                  					; get physical drive number
 11098 000008E9 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 11099 000008EA 57                      		push	di
 11100 000008EB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 11101                                  scan_list:				
 11102 000008EF 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 11103 000008F3 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 11104 000008F5 B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 11105 000008F7 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 11106 000008FB 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 11107 000008FD 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 11108 00000901 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 11109 00000902 07                      		pop	es
 11110 00000903 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 11111                                  
 11112                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 11113                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 11114                                  ; in this case.
 11115 00000907 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 11116 0000090C 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 11117                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 11118 0000090E 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 11119 00000913 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 11120 00000915 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 11121                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 11122                                  					; get the DOS drive letter

 11191                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11192                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 11193                                  ;
 11194                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 11195                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 11196                                  ;	cx = sector count
 11197                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 11198                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 11199                                  ;	ds = cs
 11200                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 11201                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 11202                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 11203                                  ;

 11205                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
