 13590                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13591                                  ; Ioctl_Support_Query
 13592                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13593                                  ;
 13594                                  ; New device command which was added in DOS 5.00 to allow a query of a 
 13595                                  ; specific GENERIC IOCtl to see if it is supported. Bit 7 in the
 13596                                  ; device attributes specifies if this function is supported.
 13597                                  ;
 13598                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13599                                  
 13600                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13601                                  ioctl_support_query:
 13602 000012DF 06                      		push	es
 13603 000012E0 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX Points to request header.
 13604 000012E4 268B470D                		mov	ax, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 13605                                  					; AL ==	Major, AH == Minor
 13606                                  
 13607                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13608                                  		;cmp	al, 48h		; IOC_NEW_DC (PCDOS 7.1)
 13609                                  		;			; new generic ioctl function (FAT32)
 13610                                  		;jz	short ioctl_support
 13611                                  
 13612 000012E8 3C08                    		cmp	al, 8		; IOC_DC
 13613                                  					; See if major code is 8
 13614 000012EA 7513                    		jnz	short nosupport
 13615                                  ioctl_support:
 13616 000012EC 0E                      		push	cs
 13617 000012ED 07                      		pop	es
 13618                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13619                                  		;mov	cx, 14          ; (PCDOS 7.1) IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 13620 000012EE B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 13621                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13622 000012F1 BF[D20C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 13623                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 13624                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 13625 000012F4 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 13626 000012F6 F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 13627 000012F8 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 13628 000012FA B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 13629                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13630                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 13631                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 13632                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 13633                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 13634                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13635                                  ioctlsupexit:
 13636 000012FD 07                      		pop	es
 13637                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13638                                  		; cf = 0
 13639                                  		;clc
 13640 000012FE C3                      		retn
 13641                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13642                                  nosupport:
 13643 000012FF 07                      		pop	es
 13644 00001300 E9D2ED                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 13645                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 13647                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13648                                  
 13649                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13650                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 13651                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13652                                  ;
 13653                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 13654                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 13655                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 13656                                  ;	    drive)
 13657                                  ;
 13658                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 13659                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 13660                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 13661                                  ;
 13662                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 13663                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 13664                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 13665                                  ;
 13666                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 13667                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 13668                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13669                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13670                                  ;
 13671                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 13672                                  ;
 13673                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 13674                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 13675                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 13676                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 13677                                  ; 
 13678                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13679                                  
 13680                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13681                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13682 00001303 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13683 00001307 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13684                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13685                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13686 0000130A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13687 0000130C 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13688                                  		;
 13689 0000130E 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13690                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13691                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13692                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13693 00001312 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13694                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13695 00001314 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13696 00001316 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13697 00001318 FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13698                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13699 0000131A FEC8                    		dec	al
 13700 0000131C 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13701 0000131E 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13702 00001320 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13703 00001322 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13704 00001324 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13705 00001326 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13706 00001328 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13707                                  GotMediaType:				
 13708 0000132A 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13709                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13710                                  		; cf = 0
 13711                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13712 0000132D C3                      		retn
 13713                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13714                                  
 13715                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13716 0000132E 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13717 00001331 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13718 00001333 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13719 00001335 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13720 00001338 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13721                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13722 0000133A B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13723                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13724 0000133C B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13725 0000133E F9                      		stc
 13726 0000133F C3                      		retn
 13727                                  
 13728                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13729                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13730                                  		;db    0
 13731                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13732                                  
 13733                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13734                                  
 13735                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13736                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13737                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13738                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13739                                  
 13740                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13741                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13742                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13743                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13744                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13745                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13746                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13747                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13748                                  ;
 13749                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13750                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13751                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13752                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13753                                  ;
 13754                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13755                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13756                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13757                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13758                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13759                                  ;
 13760                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13761                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13762                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13763                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13764                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13765                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13766                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13767                                  
 13768                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13769                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13770                                  
 13771                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13772                                  
 13773                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13774 00001340 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13775 00001343 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13776 00001345 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13777 00001348 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13778                                  
 13779                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13780                                  
 13781 0000134A 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13782 0000134D 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13783 0000134F 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT

 14034                                  
 14035                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14036                                  ;
 14037                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14038                                  ;
 14039                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14040                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14041                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14042                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14043                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14044                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14045                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14046                                  ;
 14047                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14048                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14049                                  ;
 14050                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14051                                  
 14052                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14053                                  HMAPtr:
 14054 0000143B 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14055                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14056 00001440 8B3E[9508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14057                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14058 00001444 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14059 00001447 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14060 00001449 803E[9B08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14061                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14062 0000144E 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14063 00001450 FF1E[9708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14064                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14065 00001454 8B3E[9508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14066                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14067                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14068 00001458 C3                      		retn
 14069                                  
 14070                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14071                                  
 14072                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14073                                  
 14074                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14075                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14076                                  
 14077                                  move_sector:
 14078                                  
 14079                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14080                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14081                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14082                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14083                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14084                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14085                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14086                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14087                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14088                                  ;
 14089                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14090                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14091                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14092                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14093                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14094                                  
 14095 00001459 FC                      		cld
 14096 0000145A 51                      		push	cx
 14097 0000145B B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14098 0000145E 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14099 00001462 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14100 00001464 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14101 00001468 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14102 0000146A F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14103 0000146C 59                      		pop	cx
 14104 0000146D C3                      		retn
 14105                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14106                                  
 14107                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14108 0000146E D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14109 00001470 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14110 00001472 59                      		pop	cx
 14111 00001473 C3                      		retn
 14112                                  
 14113                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14114                                  
 14115                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14116                                  
 14117                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14118                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14119                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14120                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14121                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14122                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14123                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14124                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14125                                  ;
 14126                                  ; input conditions:
 14127                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14128                                  ;
 14129                                  ; output:
 14130                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14131                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14132                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14133                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14134                                  
 14135                                  check_wrap:	
 14136 00001474 50                      		push	ax
 14137 00001475 53                      		push	bx
 14138 00001476 06                      		push	es
 14139 00001477 57                      		push	di
 14140 00001478 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14141 0000147B 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14142                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14143 0000147D 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14144                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14145 00001482 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14146 00001484 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14147 00001488 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14148 0000148A 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14149 0000148D 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14150 0000148F 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14151 00001491 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14152                                  
 14153                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14154                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14155                                  
 14156 00001493 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14157 00001495 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14158                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14159 00001497 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14160 00001498 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14161                                  					; if on	boundary
 14162                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14163                                  not_on_bound:
 14164 0000149A 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14165 0000149D 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14166 0000149F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14167 000014A1 40                      		inc	ax
 14168 000014A2 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14169 000014A4 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14170                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14171 000014A7 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14172 000014AB 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14173                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14174                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14175 000014AD 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14176 000014AF 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14177 000014B0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14178                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14179 000014B2 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14180                                  
 14181                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14182                                  
 14183 000014B4 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14184 000014B6 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14185 000014B8 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14186                                  
 14187                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14188                                  
 14189 000014BA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14190 000014BC 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14191 000014BE 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14192                                  no_head_bound:				
 14193 000014BF 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14194 000014C1 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14195 000014C2 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14196 000014C4 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14197 000014C6 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14198 000014C8 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14199 000014CB B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14200 000014CD 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14201 000014CF D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14202 000014D1 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14203 000014D3 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14204 000014D5 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14205 000014D7 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14206 000014D9 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14207                                  no_wrap:				
 14208 000014DB F8                      		clc
 14209 000014DC 5F                      		pop	di
 14210 000014DD 07                      		pop	es
 14211 000014DE 5B                      		pop	bx
 14212 000014DF 58                      		pop	ax
 14213 000014E0 C3                      		retn
 14214                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14215                                  
 14216                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14217 000014E1 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14218 000014E3 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14219 000014E5 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14220                                  
 14221                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14222                                  
 14223                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14224                                  
 14225                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14226                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14227                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14228                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14229                                  ;
 14230                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14231                                  
 14232                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14233                                  find_bds:	
 14234 000014E7 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14235                                  fbds_1:					
 14236 000014EB 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14237 000014EF 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14238 000014F1 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14239                                  					; go to next bds
 14240 000014F4 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14241 000014F7 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14242 000014F9 F9                      		stc
 14243                                  fdbs_2:					
 14244 000014FA C3                      		retn
 14245                                  
 14246                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14247                                  
 14248                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14249                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14250                                  doint:
 14251                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14252 000014FB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14253                                  					; get physical drive number
 14254                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14255                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14256                                  		
 14257 000014FE 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14258 00001500 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14259 00001502 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14260                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14261 00001504 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14262                                  					; get request code
 14263                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14264 00001507 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14265                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14266 0000150A 9D                      		popf
 14267                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14268                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14269 0000150B 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14270                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14271                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14272 00001510 9C                      		pushf
 14273                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14274 00001511 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14275                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14276                                  dointdone:				
 14277 00001514 C3                      		retn
 14278                                  
 14279                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14280                                  
 14281                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14282                                  
 14283                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14284                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14285                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14286                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14287                                  ;
 14288                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14289                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14290                                  ;
 14291                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14292                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14293                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14294                                  
 14295                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14296                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14297                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14298                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14299                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14300                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14301                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14302                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14303                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14304                                  ;end struc
 14305                                  
 14306                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14307                                  
 14308                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14309                                  ;	ah = function
 14310                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14311                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14312                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14313                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14314                                  ;   output conditions:
 14315                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14316                                  
 14317                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14318                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14319                                  ;
 14320                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14321                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14322                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14323                                  
 14324                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14325                                  
 14326                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14327                                  
 14328 00001515 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14329                                  
 14330                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14331                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14332                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14333                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14334                                  
 14335                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14336                                  
 14337                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14338                                  
 14339                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14340                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14341                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14342                                  
 14343                                  format_special_stuff:			
 14344 00001519 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14345 0000151E 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14346 00001520 53                      		push	bx
 14347 00001521 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14348 00001524 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14349 00001527 5B                      		pop	bx
 14350 00001528 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14351                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14352                                  
 14353                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14354                                  
 14355                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14356                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14357                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14358                                  
 14359                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14360                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 14361 0000152A 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14362 0000152C 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14363 0000152E 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14364 0000152F 51                      		push	cx
 14365 00001530 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14366 00001532 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14367 00001534 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14368 00001536 8406[2905]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14369 0000153A 59                      		pop	cx
 14370 0000153B 58                      		pop	ax
 14371 0000153C 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14372                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14373 0000153E 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14374 0000153F 06                      		push	es
 14375                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14376 00001540 2EC41E[1515]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14377                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14378                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14379 00001545 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14380 00001547 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14381 0000154A 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14382                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14383                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14384 0000154E 07                      		pop	es
 14385 0000154F 5B                      		pop	bx
 14386 00001550 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14387                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14388                                  
 14389                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14390                                  
 14391                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14392                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14393                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14394                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14395                                  
 14396                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 14397 00001552 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14398                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14399 00001557 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14400 00001559 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14401                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14402 0000155E 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14403                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 14404 00001560 50                      		push	ax
 14405 00001561 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14406                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14407                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14408 00001563 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14409                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14410                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14411 00001568 58                      		pop	ax
 14412 00001569 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14413                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14414                                  
 14415                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14416                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14417                                  
 14418                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14419                                  
 14420                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14421                                  
 14422                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14423                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14424                                  
 14425                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14426 0000156B 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14427                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14428                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14429 0000156C 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14430                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14431                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14432                                  
 14433                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14434                                  
 14435 00001571 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14436 00001574 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14437 00001577 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14438                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14439                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 14440 00001579 803E[2905]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14441 0000157E 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14442                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14443                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14444                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 14445 00001580 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14446                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14447                                  		
 14448 00001585 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14449                                  		
 14450 00001586 803E[3606]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14451                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14452 0000158B 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14453                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14454                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 14455 0000158D 9D                      		popf
 14456 0000158E 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14457                                  ret_from_i13:				
 14458 00001590 1F                      		pop	ds
 14459 00001591 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14460                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14461                                  
 14462                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14463                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14464                                  ; a changeline error.
 14465                                  
 14466                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 14467 00001594 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14468                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14469 00001596 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14470 00001599 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14471 0000159B 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14472 0000159D 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14473 0000159F 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14474 000015A4 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14475                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14476                                  					; never	would
 14477 000015A6 53                      		push	bx
 14478 000015A7 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14479 000015AA E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14480 000015AD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14481                                  int13b:					
 14482 000015AE F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14483 000015AF EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14484                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14485                                  
 14486                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14487                                  
 14488                                  goterr13:				
 14489 000015B1 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14490 000015B4 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14491                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 14492 000015B6 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14493 000015B9 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14494 000015BB 803E[3006]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14495 000015C0 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14496                                  
 14497 000015C2 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14498                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14499                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14500                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14501 000015C7 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14502                                  
 14503 000015C9 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14504                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14505                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14506 000015CB 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14507                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14508                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14509 000015D0 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14510 000015D3 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14511 000015D5 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14512 000015D7 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14513 000015D9 53                      		push	bx
 14514 000015DA 51                      		push	cx
 14515 000015DB 52                      		push	dx
 14516 000015DC A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14517                                  loop_ecc:				
 14518 000015DF B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14519                                  
 14520                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14521                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14522                                  ;
 14523                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14524                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14525                                  ; track.
 14526                                  ;
 14527                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14528                                  ; this request.
 14529                                  ;
 14530                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14531                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14532                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14533                                  ;
 14534 000015E2 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14535                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14536                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14537 000015E5 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14538                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14539 000015EA 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14540 000015EC 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14541 000015EF 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14542 000015F1 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14543 000015F4 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14544                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14545                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14546                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14547 000015F6 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14548                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14549                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14550                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14551                                  ok11_op:				
 14552 000015F8 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14553 000015FC 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14554 000015FE FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14555                                  					; add 200h to address
 14556 00001600 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14557 00001602 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14558 00001604 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14559                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14560                                  
 14561                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14562                                  
 14563                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 14564 00001606 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14565                                  ok11_exit:				
 14566 00001607 5A                      		pop	dx
 14567 00001608 59                      		pop	cx
 14568 00001609 5B                      		pop	bx
 14569 0000160A EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14570                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14571                                  
 14572                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14573                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14574                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14575                                  
 14576                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 14577 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 14578 0000160D 53                      		push	bx
 14579 0000160E BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14580 00001611 1E                      		push	ds
 14581 00001612 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14582 00001613 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14583                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14584                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14585 00001616 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14586                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14587 0000161B 5B                      		pop	bx
 14588 0000161C 07                      		pop	es
 14589 0000161D 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14590 0000161F 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14591 00001622 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14592                                  
 14593                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14594                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14595                                  
 14596                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 14597 00001624 56                      		push	si
 14598 00001625 57                      		push	di
 14599 00001626 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14600 00001628 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14601 0000162B E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14602 0000162E 5F                      		pop	di
 14603 0000162F 5E                      		pop	si
 14604 00001630 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14605                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14606                                  
 14607                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14608                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14609                                  
 14610                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14611 00001632 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14612 00001635 FB                      		sti
 14613 00001636 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14614 00001639 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14615                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14616                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14617 0000163B 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14618 0000163E 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14619 00001640 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14620 00001643 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14621 00001645 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14622                                  
 14623                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14624                                  
 14625                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14626                                  
 14627 00001647 52                      		push	dx
 14628 00001648 51                      		push	cx
 14629 00001649 53                      		push	bx
 14630 0000164A 50                      		push	ax
 14631 0000164B 55                      		push	bp
 14632 0000164C 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14633 0000164E 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14634 00001650 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14635 00001652 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14636 00001654 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14637 00001656 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14638 00001658 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14639 0000165A 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14640                                  
 14641                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14642                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14643                                  
 14644 0000165E 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14645 00001660 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14646                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14647                                  
 14648                                  no_skip_first:				
 14649 00001663 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14650 00001665 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14651 00001667 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14652                                  
 14653                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14654                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14655                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14656                                  ;
 14657                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14658                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14659                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14660                                  ; in error.
 14661                                  
 14662 00001669 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14663 0000166B 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14664                                  
 14665                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14666                                  
 14667 0000166D 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14668                                  					; set up head number
 14669 00001670 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14670 00001673 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14671                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14672                                  
 14673                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14674 00001676 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14675 00001678 F9                      		stc
 14676 00001679 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14677                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14678                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14679                                  
 14680                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14681                                  
 14682                                  intverify:				
 14683 0000167C 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14684 0000167D 53                      		push	bx
 14685 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14686 0000167F 07                      		pop	es
 14687                                  dosimple:				
 14688 00001680 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14689                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14690                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14691                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14692 00001683 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14693                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14694 00001688 5B                      		pop	bx
 14695 00001689 07                      		pop	es
 14696 0000168A E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14697                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14698                                  
 14699                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14700                                  
 14701                                  intformat:				
 14702 0000168D 06                      		push	es
 14703 0000168E 53                      		push	bx
 14704 0000168F 56                      		push	si
 14705 00001690 57                      		push	di
 14706 00001691 1E                      		push	ds
 14707                                  
 14708                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14709                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14710                                  
 14711 00001692 06                      		push	es
 14712 00001693 1E                      		push	ds
 14713 00001694 07                      		pop	es
 14714 00001695 1F                      		pop	ds
 14715 00001696 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14716 00001698 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14717 0000169B E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14718 0000169E 1F                      		pop	ds
 14719 0000169F 5F                      		pop	di
 14720 000016A0 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14721 000016A1 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14722                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14723                                  
 14724                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14725                                  ; the first block.
 14726                                  ;
 14727                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14728                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14729                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14730                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14731                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14732                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14733                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14734                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14735                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14736                                  
 14737                                  doblock:
 14738                                  
 14739                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14740                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14741                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14742                                  				
 14743 000016A3 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14744                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14745 000016A6 51                      		push	cx
 14746 000016A7 06                      		push	es
 14747 000016A8 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14748                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14749 000016A9 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14750 000016AC 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14751                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14752 000016B0 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14753                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14754 000016B5 5F                      		pop	di
 14755 000016B6 07                      		pop	es
 14756 000016B7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14757 000016B9 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14758 000016BB B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14759 000016BD 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14760                                  doblockflop:				
 14761 000016BF 59                      		pop	cx
 14762                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14763 000016C0 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14764 000016C2 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14765 000016C4 50                      		push	ax
 14766 000016C5 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14767 000016C7 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14768                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14769                                  
 14770                                  doblocklast:				
 14771 000016C9 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14772 000016CB 50                      		push	ax
 14773                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14774 000016CC E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14775 000016CF 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14776 000016D1 58                      		pop	ax
 14777 000016D2 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14778                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14779 000016D5 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14780 000016D7 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14781 000016D9 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14782 000016DB 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14783 000016DD 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14784                                  					; then we are done already.
 14785 000016DF 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14786                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14787 000016E1 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14788 000016E4 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14789                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14790                                  
 14791                                  bufferx:				
 14792 000016E6 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14793                                  					; set up head number
 14794                                  buffer:					
 14795 000016E9 53                      		push	bx
 14796 000016EA 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14797 000016ED 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14798 000016F0 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14799                                  					
 14800                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14801                                  
 14802 000016F2 06                      		push	es
 14803 000016F3 1E                      		push	ds
 14804 000016F4 56                      		push	si
 14805 000016F5 57                      		push	di
 14806 000016F6 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14807 000016F7 06                      		push	es
 14808 000016F8 1F                      		pop	ds
 14809 000016F9 07                      		pop	es
 14810 000016FA BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14811 000016FD 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14812 000016FE 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14813 00001700 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14814 00001703 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14815                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14816 00001704 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14817 00001705 5E                      		pop	si
 14818 00001706 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14819                                  
 14820                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14821                                  
 14822 00001707 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14823                                  					; get drive number
 14824 00001709 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14825 0000170C E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14826                                  					;
 14827                                  					; ah is	function
 14828                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14829                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14830                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14831                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14832                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14833 0000170F E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14834 00001712 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14835 00001713 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14836 00001715 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14837                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14838                                  
 14839                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14840                                  
 14841                                  doread:					
 14842 00001717 06                      		push	es
 14843 00001718 53                      		push	bx
 14844 00001719 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14845 0000171A 07                      		pop	es
 14846 0000171B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14847 0000171E B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14848 00001720 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14849                                  					; get drive number
 14850 00001723 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14851                                  					; ah = function
 14852                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14853                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14854                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14855 00001726 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14856 00001729 5B                      		pop	bx
 14857 0000172A 07                      		pop	es
 14858 0000172B 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14859 0000172D 56                      		push	si
 14860 0000172E 57                      		push	di
 14861 0000172F 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14862 00001731 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14863 00001734 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14864 00001737 5F                      		pop	di
 14865 00001738 5E                      		pop	si
 14866                                  
 14867                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14868                                  
 14869                                  dotail:					
 14870 00001739 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14871 0000173A 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14872 0000173D 41                      		inc	cx
 14873 0000173E 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14874 00001741 F8                      		clc
 14875 00001742 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14876 00001744 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14877                                  
 14878                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14879                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14880                                  
 14881 00001746 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14882 00001749 E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14883 0000174C E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14884                                  
 14885                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14886                                  
 14887                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14888                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14889                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14890                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14891                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14892                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14893                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14894                                  
 14895                                  bad13:					
 14896 0000174F 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14897 00001751 5D                      		pop	bp
 14898 00001752 5B                      		pop	bx
 14899 00001753 5B                      		pop	bx
 14900 00001754 59                      		pop	cx
 14901 00001755 5A                      		pop	dx
 14902 00001756 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14903 00001758 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14904                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14905                                  
 14906                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14907 0000175B E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14908                                  
 14909                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14910                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14911                                  		;db 	0
 14912                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14913                                  
 14914                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14924                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
