 15971                                  
 15972                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15973                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 15974                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15975                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 30/12/2022))
 15976                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15977                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 15978                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15979                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 15980                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15981                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit6.s -l sysinit6.lst -o SYSINIT6.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 15982                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15983                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 15984                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15985                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 15986                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 15987                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15988                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 15989                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 15990                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 15991                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 15992                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 15993                                  
 15994                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 15995                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 - 2019
 15996                                  ; SYSINIT (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) draft: 'sysinit3.s' (01/07/2019)
 15997                                   
 15998                                  ; 21/10/2022
 15999                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16000                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 16001                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 16002                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 16003                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16004                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 16005                                  
 16006                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 16007                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 16008                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 16009                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 16010                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 16011                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 16012                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 16013                                  ;
 16014                                  ;
 16015                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 16016                                  ;
 16017                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 16018                                  ;
 16019                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 16020                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 16021                                  ;
 16022                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 16023                                  ;
 16024                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 16025                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 16026                                  ;
 16027                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 16028                                  ;
 16029                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 16030                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 16031                                  ;value.
 16032                                  ;
 16033                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 16034                                  ;
 16035                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 16036                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 16037                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 16038                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 16039                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 16040                                  ;
 16041                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 16042                                  ;
 16043                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 16044                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 16045                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 16046                                  ;
 16047                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 16048                                  ;
 16049                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 16050                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 16051                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 16052                                  ;
 16053                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 16054                                  ;
 16055                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 16056                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 16057                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 16058                                  ;
 16059                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 16060                                  ;
 16061                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 16062                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 16063                                  ;
 16064                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 16065                                  ;
 16066                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 16067                                  ;
 16068                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 16069                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 16070                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 16071                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 16072                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 16073                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 16074                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 16075                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 16076                                  ;memory.
 16077                                  ;NOTES:
 16078                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 16079                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 16080                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 16081                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 16082                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 16083                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 16084                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 16085                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 16086                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 16087                                  
 16088                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16089                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 16090                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16091                                  
 16092                                  ;include version.inc
 16093                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16094                                  
 16095                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 16096                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 16097                                  
 16098                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 16099                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 16100                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 16101                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 16102                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 16103                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 16104                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 16105                                  
 16106                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 16107                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16108                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 16109                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 16110                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16111                                  
 16112                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 16113                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16114                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 16115                                  ;MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 16116                                  
 16117                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21)
 16118                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	6
 16119                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	22
 16120                                  
 16121                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 16122                                  
 16123                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 16124                                  				; currently 0.
 16125                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 16126                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 16127                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 16128                                  
 16129                                  ;      if1
 16130                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 16131                                  ;      endif
 16132                                  
 16133                                         ;******************************
 16134                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 16135                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 16136                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 16137                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 16138                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 16139                                         ;******************************
 16140                                  
 16141                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16142                                  ; device definitions
 16143                                  
 16144                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 16145                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 16146                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 16147                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 16148                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 16149                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 16150                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 16151                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 16152                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 16153                                  
 16154                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 16155                                  struc	SYSDEV
 16156 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 16157 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 16158 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 16159 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 16160 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 16161                                  .size:
 16162                                  endstruc
 16163                                  
 16164                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 16165                                  struc	SRHEAD
 16166 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 16167 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 16168 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 16169 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 16170 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 16171                                  .size:
 16172                                  endstruc
 16173                                  
 16174                                  ;Status word masks
 16175                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 16176                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 16177                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 16178                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 16179                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 16180                                  
 16181                                  ;Function codes
 16182                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 16183                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 16184                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 16185                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 16186                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 16187                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 16188                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 16189                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 16190                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 16191                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 16192                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 16193                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 16194                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 16195                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 16196                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 16197                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 16198                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 16199                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 16200                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 16201                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 16202                                  
 16203                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16204                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 16205 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 16206 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 16207 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 16208 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 16209 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 16210 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 16211                                                          ; word
 16212 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 16213 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 16214 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 16215 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 16216                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 16217                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 16218                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16219                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16220                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16221                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16222                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 16223                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16224 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 16225 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 16226 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 16227 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 16228 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 16229 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 16230                                  .size:
 16231                                  endstruc
 16232                                  
 16233                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16234                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 16235                                  
 16236                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 16237                                  
 16238                                  struc buffinfo
 16239 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 16240 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 16241 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16242                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 16243                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 16244 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 16245                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 16246                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 16247                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 16248                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 16249                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 16250                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 16251                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 16252                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 16253 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 16254                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 16255 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 16256 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 16257 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 16258 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 16259 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 16260                                  .size:
 16261                                  endstruc
 16262                                  
 16263                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 16264                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 16265                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 16266                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 16267                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 16268                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 16269                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 16270                                  
 16271                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 16272                                  
 16273                                  
 16274                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 16275                                  
 16276                                  ;Flag byte masks
 16277                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 16278                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 16279                                  ;***
 16280                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 16281                                  ;***
 16282                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 16283                                  
 16284                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 16285                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 16286                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 16287                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 16288                                  
 16289                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 16293                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16294                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 16295                                  
 16296                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 16297                                  
 16298                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 16299                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 16300                                  ;
 16301                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 16302                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 16303                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 16304                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 16305                                  ;
 16306                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 16307                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 16308                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 16309                                  
 16310                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 16311                                  
 16312                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16313                                  
 16314                                  struc	DPB
 16315 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 16316 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 16317 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 16318 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 16319 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 16320 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 16321 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 16322 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 16323 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 16324 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 16325                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16326 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 16327 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 16328 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 16329 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 16330 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 16331                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 16332 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 16333 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 16334 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 16335                                  .size:
 16336                                  endstruc
 16337                                  
 16338                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 16339                                  
 16340                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 16341

 16399                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 16400                                  ;
 16401                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 16402                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 16403                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 16404                                  ;
 16405                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 16406                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 16407                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 16408                                  ;
 16409                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 16410                                  
 16411                                  struc A_BPB
 16412 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 16413 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 16414 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 16415 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 16416 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 16417 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 16418 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 16419 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 16420 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 16421 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 16422 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 16423 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 16424 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 16425 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 16426 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 16427                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 16428                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 16429                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 16430                                  .size:
 16431                                  endstruc
 16432                                  
 16433                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 16434 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 16435 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 16436 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 16437 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 16438 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 16439 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 16440 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 16441 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 16442                                  endstruc

 16690                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16691                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 16692                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16693                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 16694                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 16695                                  									  
 16696                                  ;*******************************					  
 16697                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 16698                                  ;*******************************					  
 16699                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 16700                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 16701                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 16702                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16703                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16704                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16705                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16706                                  ;For all others:							  
 16707                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16708                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16709                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16710                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16711                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16712                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16713                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16714                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16715                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16716                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16717                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16718                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16719                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16720                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16721                                  ;									  
 16722                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16723                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16724                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16725                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16726                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16727                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16728                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16729                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16730                                  ;									  
 16731                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16732                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16733                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16734                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16735                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16736                                  ;									  
 16737                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16738                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16739                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16740                                  ;									  
 16741                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16742                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16743                                  ;									  
 16744                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16745                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16746                                  ;									  
 16747                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16748                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16749                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16750                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16751                                  ;						called. 		  
 16752                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 16753                                  ;									  
 16754                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16755                                  ;									  
 16756                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16757                                  ;									  
 16758                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16759                                  ;									  
 16760                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16761                                  ;									  
 16762                                  
 16763                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16764                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16765 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16766 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16767                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16768 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16769 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16770 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 16771 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 16772                                  endstruc					  
 16773

 16881                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16882                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16883                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16884                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16885                                  
 16886                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16887                                  ;
 16888                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16889                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16890                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16891                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16892                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16893                                  ;
 16894                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16895                                  ;
 16896                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16897                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16898                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16899                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16900                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16901                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16902                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16903                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16904                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16905                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16906                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16907                                  
 16908                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16909                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16910                                  
 16911                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16912                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16913 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16914 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16915 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16916 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16917 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16918 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16919                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16920 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 16921 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 16922 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 16923                                  .size:
 16924                                  endstruc
 16925                                  
 16926                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 16927                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 16928                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 16929                                  						; argument
 16930                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 16931

 16933

 16935                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16936                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B

 16939                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 16941                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16942                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16943                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16944                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16945                                  
 16946                                  ; system file table
 16947                                  
 16948                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16949                                  ;
 16950                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16951                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16952                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16953                                  
 16954                                  struc	SF
 16955 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16956 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16957 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16958                                  .size:
 16959                                  endstruc
 16960                                  
 16961                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16962                                  ;
 16963                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16964                                  
 16965                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16966 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16967                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16968 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16969 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16970 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16971                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16972                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16973                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16974                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16975                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16976                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16977                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16978                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16979                                  					;
 16980                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16981                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16982                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16983                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16984                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16985                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16986                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16987                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16988                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16989                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16990                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device

 17303                                  ; 05/07/2018
 17304                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17305                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17306                                  
 17307                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17308                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 17309                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17310                                  
 17311                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 17312                                  ;
 17313                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 17314                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 17315                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 17316                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 17317                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 17318                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 17319                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 17320                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 17321                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 17322                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 17323                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 17324                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 17325                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 17326                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 17327                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 17328                                  ;
 17329                                  
 17330                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 17331                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 17332                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 17333                                  ;
 17334                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 17335                                  ;
 17336                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 17337                                  ;
 17338                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 17339                                  ;
 17340                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 17341                                  ;
 17342                                  
 17343                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 17344                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 17345                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 17346                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 17347                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 17348                                  ;      deeply nested one
 17349                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 17350                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 17351                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 17352                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 17353                                  
 17354                                  		;EVEN
 17355                                  ;align 2
 17356                                  		; 21/10/2022
 17357                                  
 17358 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 17359 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 17360 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 17361 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 17362 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 17363 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 17364                                  
 17365 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 17366 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17367 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 17368                                  
 17369                                  ;***********************************************************************
 17370                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 17371                                  
 17372                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17373                                  
 17374 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 17375                                  
 17376                                  int02:
 17377                                  
 17378                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17379                                  ;
 17380                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 17381                                  ;
 17382                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 17383                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 17384                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 17385                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 17386                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 17387                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 17388                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 17389                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 17390                                  ;
 17391                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 17392                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 17393                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 17394                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 17395                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 17396                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 17397                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 17398                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 17399                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 17400                                  ;
 17401                                  ; *********************************************************************
 17402                                  
 17403 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 17404 00000017 06                      	push	es
 17405 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 17406 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17407                                  	; 02/11/2022
 17408 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 17409 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 17410 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 17411                                  
 17412 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 17413                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 17414                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 17415                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 17416                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 17417 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 17418 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 17419                                  special02:
 17420 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 17421 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 17422                                  normal02:
 17423 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 17424 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 17425 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02
 17426                                  
 17427                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17428                                  
 17429 00000038 00000000                old08:	dd	0
 17430                                  
 17431                                  int08:
 17432 0000003C E80801                  	call	do_int_stacks
 17433 0000003F [3800]                  	dw	old08
 17434                                  
 17435                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17436                                  
 17437 00000041 00000000                old09:	dd	0
 17438                                  
 17439                                  int09:
 17440                                  
 17441                                  ; keyboard interrupt must have a three byte jump, a nop and a zero byte
 17442                                  ; as its first instruction for compatibility reasons
 17443                                  
 17444 00000045 EB02                    	jmp	short keyboard_lbl
 17445 00000047 90                      	nop
 17446 00000048 00                      	db	0
 17447                                  
 17448                                  keyboard_lbl:
 17449 00000049 E8FB00                  	call	do_int_stacks
 17450 0000004C [4100]                  	dw	old09
 17451                                  
 17452                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17453                                  
 17454 0000004E 00000000                old70:	dd	0
 17455                                  
 17456                                  int70:
 17457 00000052 E8F200                  	call	do_int_stacks
 17458 00000055 [4E00]                  	dw	old70
 17459                                  
 17460                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17461                                  
 17462                                  ;	irp	a,<0a,0b,0c,0d,0e,72,73,74,76,77>
 17463                                  ;public	int&a
 17464                                  ;public	old&a
 17465                                  ;public	firstflag&a
 17466                                  ;int&a	proc	far
 17467                                  ;	jmp	short entry_int&a&_stk
 17468                                  ;old&a	dd	  0		;forward pointer
 17469                                  ;	dw	  424bh 	;compatible signature for int. sharing
 17470                                  ;firstflag&a db   0		;the firstly hooked.
 17471                                  ;	jmp	short intret_&a	;reset routine. we don't care this.
 17472                                  ;	db	7 dup (0)	;reserved for future.
 17473                                  ;entry_int&a&_stk:

 17475                                  ;	dw	old&a
 17476                                  ;intret_&a:

 17479                                  ;	endm

 17482                                  
 17483                                  int0A:

 17652                                  
 17653                                  ;********************************************************************
 17654                                  ;common routines
 17655                                  ;********************************************************************
 17656                                  
 17657                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 17658                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 17659                                  ; service routine
 17660                                  
 17661                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 17662                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17663                                  
 17664                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 17665                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 17666                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 17667                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 17668                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 17669                                  
 17670                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 17671                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 17672                                  
 17673                                  do_int_stacks:
 17674 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 17675 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 17676 00000149 06                      	push	es
 17677 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 17678 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 17679 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 17680                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17681                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 17682                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17683 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 17684 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 17685 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 17686                                  
 17687 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 17688                                  
 17689                                  found02:
 17690 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 17691 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 17692                                  
 17693 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 17694                                  
 17695 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 17696                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17697                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 17698                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17699                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 17700 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 17701 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 17702                                  
 17703                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 17704 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 17705 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 17706 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 17707 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 17708 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 17709 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 17710 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17711 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 17712                                  
 17713                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 17714                                  	;push    bp
 17715                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 17716                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 17717                                  	;pop     bp
 17718                                  	;push    es
 17719                                  	;pop     ss
 17720                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 17721                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 17722                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17723                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 17724                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 17725                                  
 17726 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 17727                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17728 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 17729                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17730                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 17731                                  
 17732 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 17733                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17734 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 17735                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17736                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 17737 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 17738 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 17739                                  
 17740                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17741                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 17742                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17743 0000019E 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 17744 000001A3 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 17745                                  
 17746 000001A8 07                      	pop	es
 17747 000001A9 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 17748 000001AA 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 17749 000001AB 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 17750 000001AE CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 17751                                  
 17752                                  notfree02:
 17753 000001AF 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 17754 000001B1 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 17755                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17756                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 17757                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17758 000001B3 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17759                                  
 17760                                  findnext02:
 17761 000001B7 E81200                  	call	longpath
 17762 000001BA EBA8                    	jmp	short found02
 17763                                  
 17764                                  foundbad02:
 17765 000001BC 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17766 000001C1 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 17767 000001C3 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 17768                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17769                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 17770                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17771 000001C5 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 17772 000001CA EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 17773                                  
 17774                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17775                                  
 17776                                  ; Common routines
 17777                                  
 17778                                  longpath:
 17779                                  	; 21/03/2019
 17780 000001CC 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 17781                                  lploopp:
 17782                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17783                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 17784                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17785 000001D1 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 17786 000001D6 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 17787                                  
 17788 000001D8 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 17789                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17790                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 17791                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17792 000001DA 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17793 000001DE 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 17794 000001E0 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 17795                                  
 17796 000001E2 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 17797 000001E4 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 17798                                  
 17799                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17800                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 17801                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17802 000001E6 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 17803                                  inuse:
 17804 000001EA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17805 000001EF 7406                    	je	short fatal
 17806 000001F1 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 17807 000001F4 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 17808                                  found:
 17809 000001F6 C3                      	retn
 17810                                  fatal:
 17811 000001F7 1E                      	push	ds
 17812 000001F8 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 17813 000001FB 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 17814 000001FD 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 17815 00000202 1F                      	pop	ds
 17816 00000203 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 17817                                  
 17818 00000205 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 17819 00000207 E672                    	out	72h,al
 17820                                  
 17821                                  skip_nmis:
 17822 00000209 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 17823 0000020A B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 17824 0000020C E621                    	out	021h,al
 17825 0000020E E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 17826                                  
 17827 00000210 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 17828 00000212 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 17829 00000214 BE[3B02]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 17830                                  ;SR;
 17831                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 17832                                  ;
 17833 00000217 50                      	push	ax
 17834 00000218 1E                      	push	ds
 17835                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 17836                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 17837                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17838 00000219 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 17839 0000021C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 17840                                  
 17841                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 17842 0000021E F606[6F08]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 17843 00000223 1F                      	pop	ds
 17844 00000224 58                      	pop	ax
 17845 00000225 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 17846                                  
 17847                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)
 17848                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 17849                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17850 00000227 9A[7008]7000            	call	DOSBIODATASEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; 0070h:08D1h
 17851                                  ;
 17852                                  ;SR; We do not bother about the returned status of this call. 
 17853                                  ;
 17854                                  fatal_loop:
 17855 0000022C AC                      	lodsb
 17856 0000022D 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 17857 0000022F 7408                    	je	short fatal_done
 17858                                  
 17859 00000231 B307                    	mov	bl,7
 17860 00000233 B40E                    	mov	ah,14
 17861 00000235 CD10                    	int	10h			; whoops, this enables ints
 17862 00000237 EBF3                    	jmp	short fatal_loop
 17863                                  
 17864                                  fatal_done:
 17865 00000239 EBFE                    	jmp	short fatal_done
 17866

 17868                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSINIT1.ASM, 1991)

 19115                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 19116                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 19117                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 19118                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 19119                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 19120                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 19121                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 19122                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 19123                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 19124                                  ;
 19125                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 19126                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 19127                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 19128                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 19129                                  ; been patched.

 19450 00000779 BA[AB45]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 19451                                  
 19452                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 19453                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 19454                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 19455                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 19456                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 19457                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 19458                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 19459                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 19460                                  
 19461                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 19462

 19476                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 19477                                  
 19478                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 19479                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 19480                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 19481                                  
 19482                                  	; 22/10/2022

 19487                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 19488                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 19489                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 19490                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 19491                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 19492                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 19493                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 19494                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 19495                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 19496                                  ;
 19497                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 19498                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 19499                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 19500                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 19501                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 19502                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 19503                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
