 19820                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19821                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 19822                                  ;
 19823                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 19824                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 19825                                  ;
 19826                                  ; Inputs : None
 19827                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 19828                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 19829                                  ;	   free memory.
 19830                                  ;
 19831                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 19832                                  ;
 19833                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19834                                  	
 19835                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 19836                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:09A2h)
 19837                                  
 19838                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19839                                  AllocFreeMem:
 19840 000008E2 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 19841 000008E5 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 19842 000008E7 CD21                    	int	21h			; first time fails
 19843 000008E9 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 19844 000008EB CD21                    	int	21h			; second time gets it
 19845                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19846                                  	; ds = cs
 19847                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 19848                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to
 19849 000008ED A3[6803]                	mov	[area],ax
 19850 000008F0 A3[6403]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to			
 19851 000008F3 C3                      	retn				; start of free memory
 19852                                  				
 19853                                  	; include msbio.cl6
 19854                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19855                                  DOSLOMSG:
 19856 000008F4 484D41206E6F742061-     	db	'HMA not available: Loading DOS low',0Dh,0Ah,'$'
 19856 000008FD 7661696C61626C653A-
 19856 00000906 204C6F6164696E6720-
 19856 0000090F 444F53206C6F770D0A-
 19856 00000918 24

 19862                                  ; procedure : LoadDOSHiOrLo
 19863                                  ;
 19864                                  ;		Tries to move DOS into HMA. If it fails then loads
 19865                                  ;		DOS into Low memory. For ROMDOS, nothing is actually
 19866                                  ;		moved; this just tries to allocate the HMA, and prints
 19867                                  ;		a message if this is not possible.
 19868                                  ;
 19869                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19870                                  
 19871                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19872                                  LoadDOSHiOrLo:
 19873                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19874                                  	; ds = cs
 19875 00000947 E81F00                  	call	TryToMovDOSHi		; Try moving it into HMA (M024)

 19877                                  	;retn
 19878                                  	; 18/12/2022
 19879 0000094A 731C                    	jnc	short LoadDosHi_ok
 19880                                  LdngLo:
 19881                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19882                                  	;push	cs
 19883                                  	;pop	ds
 19884                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19885                                  	; ds = cs
 19886 0000094C B409                    	mov	ah,9
 19887 0000094E BA[F408]                	mov	dx,DOSLOMSG		; inform user that we are
 19888 00000951 CD21                    	int	21h			; loading low
 19889                                  
 19890                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19891                                  	; actually move the dos, and reinitialize it.
 19892

 19894                                  						;  use int 21 alloc for mem

 19897                                  	; ds = cs
 19898                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]	; give dos its temporary loc.
 19899                                  	; 23/10/2022

 19901                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION]  ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19902                                  	;mov	es,[FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 27/03/2019

 19920                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19921                                  ;
 19922                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 19923                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19924                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19925                                  ;
 19926                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19927                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19928                                  ; 
 19929                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19930                                  
 19931                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 19938 0000096C 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 19939                                  
 19940                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19941                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19942                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 19943                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19944                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19945                                  	; ds = cs
 19946 0000096E 8E06[7302]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 19947                                  ;else
 19948                                  ;	..
 19949                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19950

 19952                                  	; ds = cs

 19964                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 19965                                  ;
 19966                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 19967                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19968                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19969                                  ;
 19970                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed

 19994

 19997                                  	;xor	di,di
 19998                                  	
 19999                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20000                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 20001                                  	; 11/12/2022

 20004 00000990 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 20005                                  
 20006                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 20007                                  ;else
 20008                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 20009                                  ;

 20294                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 20300                                  AllocMemForDOS:
 20301                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20302                                  	; 14/05/2019

 20307                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20324 000009F0 09DB                    	or	bx,bx				; M012
 20325 000009F2 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax				;  can we use int 21 for alloc

 20327 000009F6 B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS

 20346                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20347                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20348                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20349                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20350                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20351                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20352                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20353                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20354                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20355                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20356                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20357                                  ;
 20358                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20359                                  
 20360                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20361                                  update_arena:
 20362 00000A10 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20363 00000A11 57                      	push	di
 20364 00000A12 51                      	push	cx
 20365 00000A13 52                      	push	dx
 20366                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20367                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 20368                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20369                                  	; ds = cs 
 20370 00000A14 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 20371 00000A18 4F                      	dec	di
 20372 00000A19 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 20373                                  						;  before sysvar
 20374 00000A1A 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 20375                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 20376 00000A1C 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 20377 00000A21 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 20378 00000A23 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 20379                                  
 20380                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 20381 00000A25 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 20382 00000A2A 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 20383 00000A2C 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 20384 00000A2E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 20385 00000A30 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20386                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 20387 00000A32 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 20388                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 20389 00000A36 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 20390 00000A3C 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 20391                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 20392 00000A3E 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 20393 00000A42 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 20394                                  	; 23/10/2022

 20396 00000A44 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 20397 00000A47 5A                      	pop	dx
 20398 00000A48 59                      	pop	cx
 20399 00000A49 5F                      	pop	di
 20400 00000A4A 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 20401 00000A4B C3                      	retn

 20425                                  ;
 20426                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20427                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20428                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20429                                  ;
 20430                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20431                                  ;

 20436                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20437                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20438                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20439                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.

 20593                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20594                                  ;
 20595                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20596                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20597                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20598                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20599                                  ;
 20600                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20601                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20602                                  ;
 20603                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20604                                  
 20605                                  StartVDHead:
 20606                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20607                                  
 20608 00000AD0 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20609 00000AD4 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20610 00000AD6 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20611 00000AD8 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20612 00000ADA 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20613                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20614 00000ADB 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20615                                  VDiskSig1:
 20616 00000AE2 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20617                                  
 20618                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20619                                  
 20620 00000AE7 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20621                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20622 00000AED 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20623 00000AFC 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20624 00000AFE 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20625                                  VDInt19:
 20626 00000AFF EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20627                                  OldVDInt19:
 20628 00000B00 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20629                                  
 20630                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20631                                  
 20632                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20633 00000B04 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20634                                  VDiskSig2:
 20635 00000B07 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20636                                  
 20637                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20638                                  
 20639 00000B0C 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20640 00000B0F 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20641 00000B11 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20642 00000B12 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20643 00000B14 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20644 00000B15 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20645 00000B17 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20646 00000B19 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20647 00000B1A 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20648 00000B1C 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20649 00000B1E 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20650 00000B20 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20651 00000B22 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20652                                  
 20653                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 20656                                  ;
 20657                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20658                                  ;
 20659                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20660                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20661                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20662                                  ;
 20663                                  ; Inputs : None
 20664                                  ;
 20665                                  ; Outputs : None
 20666                                  ;
 20667                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20668                                  ;
 20669                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20670                                  
 20671                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20672                                  
 20673                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20674 00000B24 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20675 00000B26 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20676                                  
 20677                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20678                                  
 20679                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20680 00000B28 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20681                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20682 00000B2B 2EA3[000B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20683 00000B2F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20684                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20685 00000B32 2EA3[020B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20686                                  
 20687                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20688                                  
 20689 00000B36 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20690                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20691                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20692 00000B38 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20693 00000B3B CD21                    	int	21h
 20694                                  
 20695                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20696                                  
 20697 00000B3D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20698 00000B3E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20699                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20700 00000B40 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20701                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20702 00000B47 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20703 00000B4E 40                      	inc	ax
 20704 00000B4F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20705                                  
 20706                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20707                                  
 20708 00000B51 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20709                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20710 00000B52 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20711 00000B58 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20712                                  
 20713                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20714                                  
 20715                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)

 20720 00000B64 1F                      	pop	ds
 20721 00000B65 FC                      	cld
 20722 00000B66 F3A4                    	rep	movsb

 20724

 20726

 20729 00000B6A 06                      	push	es

 20732                                  	;mov	es,ax

 20737

 20793                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 20794                                  
 20795                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20796                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20797                                  
 20798                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20799                                  
 20800                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20801                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20802                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20803                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20804                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20805                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20806                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20807                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20808                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20809                                  ;								      ;I070
 20810                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20811                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20812                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20813                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20814                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20815                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070

 20864                                  ;
 20865                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20866                                  ;
 20867                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20868                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20869                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20870                                  ;		the offset.
 20871                                  ;

 20874                                  ;

 20884 00000BFC B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment

 20890 00000C07 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h

 20893 00000C0E 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20894                                  	;
 20895                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20896                                  	;push	ds

 20905 00000C14 1F                      	pop	ds

 20948                                  ;
 20949                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20950                                  ;
 20951                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20952                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20953                                  ;
 20954                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20955                                  
 20956                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20957                                  CPMHack:
 20958 00000C3D 1E                      	push	ds
 20959 00000C3E B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20960 00000C41 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = FFFF
 20961                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20962                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20963 00000C43 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20964 00000C44 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20965 00000C46 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20966 00000C49 BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20967                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20968 00000C4C B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20969 00000C4E FC                      	cld
 20970 00000C4F F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20971 00000C51 1F                      	pop	ds
 20972 00000C52 C3                      	retn

 21075                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.
 21076                                  ;	in this case,we are going to pretended there are two dummy floppies
 21077                                  ;	in the system. still they have dpb and cds,but we are going to

 21211                                  ;
 21212                                  ; This procedure is called after the config.sys has been processed and

 21874                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21875                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21876                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21877                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21878                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21879                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21880                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21881                                  ;
 21882                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21883                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21884                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21885                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21886                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21887                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21888                                  ;
 21889                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21890                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21891                                  ;
 21892                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21893                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21894                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21895                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21896                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21897                                  ;
 21898                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21899                                  ;
 21900                                  ;			  none.
 21901                                  
 21902                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21903                                  ;
 21904                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21905                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21906                                  
 21907                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21908                                  
 21909 00000FE5 50                      	push	ax
 21910 00000FE6 53                      	push	bx
 21911 00000FE7 52                      	push	dx

 21915 00000FEB BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 21916 00000FEE EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh
 21917 00000FEF 42                      	inc	dx

 21919 00000FF1 42                      	inc	dx

 21923 00000FF5 42                      	inc	dx

 22110                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22111                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22112                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 22113                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22114                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22115                                  ;
 22116                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22117                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22118                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22119                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22120                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22121                                  ; program).
 22122                                  
 22123                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22124                                  
 22125                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22126                                  
 22127 000010CD 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22128                                  
 22129                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22130                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22131                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22132                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22133                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22134                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22135                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22136                                  ; carridge return.
 22137                                  
 22138                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22139                                  ;character after =.
 22140                                  
 22141 000010CE 06                      	push	es
 22142 000010CF 1E                      	push	ds
 22143 000010D0 07                      	pop	es
 22144 000010D1 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 22145 000010D2 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22146

 22283                                  
 22284                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22285                                  ;
 22286                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22287                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22288                                  ;
 22289                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22290                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22291                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22292                                  
 22293                                  ParaRound:
 22294 0000114B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22295 0000114E D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22296 00001150 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22297 00001152 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22298 00001154 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22299 00001156 C3                      	retn
 22300                                  
 22301                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22302                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22303                                  ;
 22304                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22305                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22306                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22307                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22308                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22309                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22310                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22311                                  ;
 22312                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22313                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22314                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22315                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22316                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22317                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22318                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 22319                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22320                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22321                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22322                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22323                                  ;
 22324                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22325                                  
 22326                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22327                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22328                                  sysinit_base:				
 22329 00001157 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22330 0000115C 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22331 00001161 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22332 00001163 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22333 00001168 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22334 0000116D 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22335 0000116E 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22336 0000116F 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22337                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22338                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22339 00001171 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22340 00001174 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22341 00001179 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22342                                  
 22343                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22344                                  
 22345 0000117B B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22346 0000117D 0E                      	push	cs
 22347 0000117E 1F                      	pop	ds
 22348                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22349                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22350                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 22351 0000117F BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22352                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22353 00001182 CD21                    	int	21h
 22354                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22355                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22356                                  
 22357                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22358                                  stall:
 22359                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22360                                  _stall: 
 22361                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22362 00001184 F4                      	hlt 
 22363                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22364                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22365 00001185 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22366                                  
 22367                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22368 00001187 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22369                                  
 22370                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22371                                  
 22372                                  sum_up:
 22373                                  
 22374                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22375                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22376                                  ;
 22377                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22378                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22379                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22380                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22381                                  ;
 22382                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22383                                  
 22384 0000118C 1E                      	push	ds
 22385                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22386                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22387 0000118D 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22388                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22389                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22390 00001191 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22391 00001193 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22392 00001195 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22393 00001197 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22394                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22395 0000119C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22396 0000119E 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22397                                  sum1:
 22398 000011A0 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22399 000011A2 46                      	inc	si
 22400 000011A3 46                      	inc	si
 22401 000011A4 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22402                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22403                                  sum_sys_code:
 22404                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22405 000011A6 BEA611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22406                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22407                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22408                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22409                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22410                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22411                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22412                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22413 000011A9 B9[704D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22414 000011AC 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22415 000011AE D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22416                                  sum2:
 22417 000011B0 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22418 000011B3 46                      	inc	si
 22419 000011B4 46                      	inc	si
 22420 000011B5 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22421 000011B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 22422 000011B8 C3                      	retn
 22423                                  
 22424                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22425                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22426                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22427                                  
 22428                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22429                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 22430 000011B9 0000                    	dw	0
 22431                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22432                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 22433 000011BB 0000                    	dw	0

 22447                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22448                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22449                                  ;
 22450                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22451                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22452                                  ;
 22453                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.

 22455                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22456                                  ;

 22523                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22524                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22525                                  ;
 22526                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22527                                  ;
 22528                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22529                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22530                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22531                                  
 22532                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22533                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22534 00001232 53                      	push	bx
 22535 00001233 52                      	push	dx
 22536 00001234 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22537 00001238 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22538                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22539 0000123D 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22540                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22541                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22542                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22543 00001240 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22544 00001242 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22545 00001244 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22546                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22547 00001247 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22548 00001249 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22549 0000124C 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22550                                  	
 22551                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22552                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22553                                  	; zf=1
 22554 0000124E 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22555                                  	; zf=1
 22556                                  	
 22557                                  	;zf=1
 22558                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22559                                  	;zf=1
 22560 0000124F 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22561                                  got_hma:

 22563 00001255 5B                      	pop	bx

 22587 0000126C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22588                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22589 00001272 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 22590                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22591 00001278 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 22592 0000127E C3                      	retn
 22593                                  
 22594                                  ; ======================================================================
 22595                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22596                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22597                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22598                                  
 22599                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22600                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22601                                  ;
 22602                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22603                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22604                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22605                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22606                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22607                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22608                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22609                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22610                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22611                                  ;
 22612                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22613                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22614                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22615                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22616                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22617                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22618                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22619                                  ;	conditions:
 22620                                  ;
 22621                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22622                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22623                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22624                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22625                                  ;
 22626                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22627                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22628                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22629                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22630                                  ;
 22631                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22632                                  ;
 22633                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22634                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22635                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22636                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22637                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22638                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22639                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22640                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22641                                  ;
 22642                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22643                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22644                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22645                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22646                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22647                                  ;
 22648                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22649                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22650                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22651                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22652                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22653                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22654                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22655                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22656                                  ;
 22657                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22658                                  
 22659                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22660                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22661                                  
 22662                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22663                                  stackinit:
 22664 0000127F 50                      	push	ax
 22665 00001280 1E                      	push	ds
 22666 00001281 06                      	push	es
 22667 00001282 53                      	push	bx
 22668 00001283 51                      	push	cx
 22669 00001284 52                      	push	dx
 22670 00001285 57                      	push	di
 22671 00001286 56                      	push	si
 22672 00001287 55                      	push	bp
 22673                                  
 22674                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22675                                  
 22676                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22677                                  	; ds = cs
 22678 00001288 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22679 0000128B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22680                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22681                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22682                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22683 0000128D 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22684                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22685 00001291 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22686 00001294 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22687                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22688 00001298 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22689                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22690                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22691                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22692 0000129B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22693                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22694 0000129F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22695 000012A1 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22696                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22697                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22698                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22699 000012A4 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22700                                  
 22701                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22702                                  
 22703                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22704                                  
 22705                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22706                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22707                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22708 000012A8 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22709                                  
 22710                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22711                                  
 22712 000012AD B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22713                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22714                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22715                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22716 000012B0 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22717 000012B2 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22718 000012B4 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22719 000012B8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22720 000012BA 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22721                                  
 22722                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22723                                  
 22724 000012BD 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22725 000012C2 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22726 000012C6 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22727 000012C8 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22728 000012CA 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22729 000012CC 06                      	push	es
 22730 000012CD 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22731                                  
 22732                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22733                                  
 22734 000012CE 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22735 000012D2 FC                      	cld
 22736 000012D3 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22737                                  
 22738 000012D5 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22739                                  
 22740                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22741                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22742                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22743                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22744                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22745                                  
 22746                                  buildloop:
 22747                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22748                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 22749                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22750                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free
 22751                                  	; 06/07/2023
 22752 000012D9 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al ; 0 ; free
 22753 000012DD 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 22754                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 22755 000012E1 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax

 22757 000012E5 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 22758                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 22759 000012E9 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]

 22761                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx
 22762 000012F1 26892F                  	mov	[es:bx],bp
 22763 000012F4 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22764                                  
 22765 000012F7 E2E0                    	loop	buildloop
 22766                                  
 22767 000012F9 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22768 000012FC 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 22769 00001300 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 22770

 22773                                  	; 05/09/2023

 22778 0000130F 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 22779

 22782                                  
 22783                                  skip_disablenmis:

 23501                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23502                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23503                                  
 23504                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23505                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23506                                  
 23507                                  new_init_loop:
 23508                                  
 23509                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23510                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23511                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23512                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23513                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23514                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23515                                  
 23516 00001471 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23517 00001474 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23518 00001476 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23519 0000147A 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23520                                  
 23521 0000147D 1E                      	push	ds
 23522                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23523                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23524                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23525 0000147E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23526 00001481 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23527 00001483 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23528 00001486 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23529 00001488 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23530 0000148C 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23531 0000148F 1F                      	pop	ds
 23532                                  
 23533 00001490 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23534 00001493 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23535 00001497 C3                      	retn
 23536                                  
 23537                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 23538                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23539                                  
 23540                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23541                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 23542                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 23543                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23544                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23545                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23546                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23547                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 23548                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23549                                  
 23550                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23551                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 23552                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23553                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 23554                                  
 23555                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 23556                                  
 23557                                  setdevmark:
 23558                                  
 23559                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23560                                  	;push	es
 23561                                  	;push	cx
 23562                                  
 23563 00001498 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 23564 0000149D 2E890E[BB14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 23565 000014A2 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 23566                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23567                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 23568 000014A4 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 23569 000014A8 41                      	inc	cx
 23570                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 23571 000014A9 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 23572                                  
 23573                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23574                                  	;pop	cx
 23575                                  	;pop	es
 23576                                  	
 23577 000014AE 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 23578 000014B3 C3                      	retn

 23779                                  
 23780                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23781                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23782                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23783                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23784                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23785                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23786                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 23787                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 23788                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23789                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 23790                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23791                                  
 23792                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23793                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23794 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 23795 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 23796 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23797                                  endstruc
