 23799                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 23800                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 23801                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 23802                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 23803                                  
 23804                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23805                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 23806                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 23807                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 23808                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 23809                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 23810                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 23811                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 23812                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 23813                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 23814                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 23815                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23816                                  
 23817                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23818                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23819 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23820 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23821 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23822                                  endstruc
 23823                                  
 23824                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23825                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23826                                  ;
 23827                                  ;
 23828                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23829                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23830                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23831                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23832                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23833                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23834                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23835                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23836                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23837                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23838                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23839                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23840                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23841                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23842                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23843                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23844                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23845                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23846                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23847                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23848                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23849                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23850                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23851                                  ;	   :
 23852                                  ;
 23853                                  ;Note:
 23854                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23855                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23856                                  ;
 23857                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23858                                  ;
 23859                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23860                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23861                                  ;
 23862                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23863                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23864                                  ;
 23865                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23866                                  ;
 23867                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23868                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23869                                  ;
 23870                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23871                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23872                                  ;
 23873                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23874                                  ;
 23875                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23876                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23877                                  ;
 23878                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23879                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23880                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23881                                  ;
 23882                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23883                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23884                                  ;
 23885                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23886                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23887                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23888                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23889                                  
 23890                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23891                                  
 23892                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23893                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23894                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23895                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23896                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23897                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23898                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23899                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23900                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23901                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23902                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23903                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23904                                  
 23905                                  ;**** Function flags
 23906                                  
 23907                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23908                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23909                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23910                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23911                                  
 23912                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23913                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23914 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23915 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23916 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23917 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23918 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23919 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23920                                  endstruc
 23921                                  
 23922                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23923                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23924                                  ;
 23925                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23926                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23927                                  ;	     +-
 23928                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23929                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23930                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23931                                  ;	     |	:
 23932                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23933                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23934                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23935                                  ;	     |	:
 23936                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23937                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23938                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23939                                  ;	     +-	:
 23940                                  ;
 23941                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23942                                  ;
 23943                                  ;Note:
 23944                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23945                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23946                                  ;
 23947                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23948                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23949                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23950                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23951                                  
 23952                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23953                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23954                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23955                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23956                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23957                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23958                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23959                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23960                                  
 23961                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23962 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23963 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23964 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23965 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23966 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23967                                  endstruc
 23968                                  
 23969                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23970                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23971                                  ;
 23972                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23973                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23974                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23975                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23976                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23977                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23978                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23979                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23980                                  ;
 23981                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23982                                  ;
 23983                                  ;            +-
 23984                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23985                                  ;	    | or
 23986                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23987                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23988                                  ;	    | or
 23989                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23990                                  ;	    | or
 23991                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23992                                  ;	    | or
 23993                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23994                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23995                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23996                                  ;	    | or
 23997                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23998                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23999                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24000                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24001                                  ;	    +-
 24002                                  ;
 24003                                  ;
 24004                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24005                                  ;      list.
 24006                                  ;
 24007                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24008                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24009                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24010                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24011                                  
 24012                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 24013                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 24014 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 24015 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 24016 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24017 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24018                                  endstruc
 24019                                  
 24020                                  ;--------------------------------
 24021                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 24022                                  
 24023                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line
 24024                                  _$P_Number	   equ	1		;AN000; Number
 24025                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 24026                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 24027                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 24028                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 24029                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 24030                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 24031                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 24032                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 24033                                  
 24034                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 24035                                  
 24036                                  ;**** Return code
 24037                                  ;
 24038                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 24039                                  
 24040                                  _$P_No_Error	   equ	0		;AN000; No error
 24041                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 24042                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 24043                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 24044                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 24045                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 24046                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 24047                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 24048                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 24049                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 24060 000014CB 00                      _$P_Terminator:	   db	0		;AN000; Terminator code (ASCII)
 24061 000014CC 0000                    _$P_DBCSEV_OFF:	   dw	0		;AN000; Offset of DBCS EV
 24062 000014CE 0000                    _$P_DBCSEV_SEG:	   dw	0		;AN000; Segment of DBCS EV
 24063 000014D0 0000                    _$P_Flags:	   dw	0		;AN000; Parser internal flags
 24064                                  %define _$P_Flags1 _$P_Flags		;AN038; to reference first byte flags
 24065                                  %define _$P_Flags2 _$P_Flags+1		;AN038; to reference second byte flags only
 24066

 24068                                  _$P_equ		   equ	01h	      ;AN000; "=" packed in string buffet
 24069                                  _$P_Neg		   equ	02h	      ;AN000; Negative value
 24070                                  _$P_Time12	   equ	04h	      ;AN000; set when PM is specified
 24071                                  _$P_Key_Cmp	   equ	08h	      ;AN000; set when keyword compare
 24072                                  _$P_SW_Cmp	   equ	10h	      ;AN000; set when switch compare
 24073                                  _$P_Extra	   equ	20h	      ;AN000; set when extra delimiter found
 24074                                  _$P_SW		   equ	40h	      ;AN000; set when switch found (tm08)
 24075                                  _$P_Signed	   equ	80h	      ;AN000; signed numeric specified
 24076                                  
 24077                                  ;in first byte of _$P_Flags, referenced as _$P_Flags1:
 24078                                  _$P_time12am	   equ	01h	      ;AN038; set when AM is specified on time
 24079                                  _$P_TIME_AGAIN	   equ	02h	      ;AN039; SET WHEN READY TO RE-PARSE TIME
 24080                                  
 24081 000014D2 0000                    _$P_SaveSI_Cmpx:   dw	0		;AN000; save si for later use by complex

 24131                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 24132                                  ; ======================================================================
 24133                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 24135                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24136                                  ; SysParse;
 24137                                  ;
 24138                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24139                                  ;
 24140                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24141                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24142                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24143                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24144                                  ;
 24145                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24146                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24147                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24148                                  ;
 24149                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24150                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24151                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24152                                  ;
 24153                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24154                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24155                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24156                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24157                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24158                                  ;
 24159                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24160                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24161                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24162                                  ;
 24163                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24164                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24165                                  ;
 24166                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24167                                  ;
 24168                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24169                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24170                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24171                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24172                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24173                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24174                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24175                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24176                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24177                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24178                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24179                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24180                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24181                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24182                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24183                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24184                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24185                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24186                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24187                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24188                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24189                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24190                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24191                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24192                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24193                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24194                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24195                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24196                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24197                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24198                                  
 24199                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24200                                  
 24201                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24202                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24203                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24204                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24205                                  
 24206                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24207                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24208                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24209                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24210                                  ;
 24211                                  
 24212                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24213                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24214                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24215                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24216                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24217                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24218                                  
 24219                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24220                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24221                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24222                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24223                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24224                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24225                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24226                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24227                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24228                                  
 24229                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24230                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24231                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24232                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24233                                  ;	     segment.
 24234                                  
 24235                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 24236                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 24237                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24238                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24239                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24240                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 24241                                  
 24242                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 24243                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 24244                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 24245                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 24246                                  
 24247                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 24248                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT
 24249                                  ;	     pointed to by non-existant CONTROL.
 24250                                  
 24251                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 24252                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 24253                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.
 24254                                  ;	     (apostrophe) _$P_SorD_Quote is removed from PSDATA.INC.
 24255                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 24256                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 24257                                  
 24258                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 24259                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 24260                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 24261                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 24262                                  
 24263                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 24264                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.
 24265

 24267

 24832                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24833                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24834                                  ;
 24835                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24836                                  ;
 24837                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24838                                  ;	    AL = type
 24839                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24840                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24841                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24842                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24843                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24844                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24845                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer

 25071                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 25072                                  ;
 25073                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 25074                                  ;
 25075                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 25076                                  ;

 25083 000018A8 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 25085                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;

 25087 000018AD 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 25088 000018AF 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 25089                                  
 25090 000018B1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 25091 000018B3 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 25092

 25094 000018BA 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 25095                                  
 25096 000018BC 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 25097 000018C0 EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 25098                                  
 25099                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 25100 000018C2 E81204                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 25101 000018C5 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.

 25107

 25115                                  ;

 25249                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25250                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25251                                  ;
 25252                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25253                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25254                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25255                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25256                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25257                                  ;
 25258                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25259                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25260                                  ;
 25261                                  ; Output:    None
 25262                                  ;
 25263                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25264                                  ;
 25265                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25266                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25267                                  
 25268                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25269                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25270                                  
 25271                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25272                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25273                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25274 0000192A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25275 0000192B 2E800E[D114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25276 00001931 2E8026[D114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25277                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023

 25279 0000193A 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25280 0000193C 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25281                                  
 25282 0000193E 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25283 00001940 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25284                                  
 25285 00001942 2E800E[D114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25286                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;

 25288                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25289 00001949 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25290 0000194C 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25291 0000194D C3                      	retn

 25552                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25553                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25554                                  ;
 25555                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25556                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25557                                  ;
 25558                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25559                                  ;
 25560                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25561                                  ;
 25562                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25563                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25564                                  
 25565                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25566                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25567 00001A2F 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25568 00001A30 2EF606[D114]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25569 00001A36 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25570                                  
 25571 00001A38 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25572 00001A39 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25573                                  
 25574                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25575 00001A3A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25576 00001A3B 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25577                                  
 25578 00001A3D F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25579 00001A3E C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25580                                  
 25581                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25582 00001A3F F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25583 00001A40 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25986                                  ;
 25987                                  ; Function:  Check if the input byte is one of file special characters
 25988                                  ;
 25989                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF

 25992                                  ; Output:    ZF = 1 , AL is one of special characters

 25996 00001BC3 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25997 00001BC4 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25998                                  	;;lea	bx,[cs:_$P_FileSp_Char] ;AC034; special character table
 25999                                  	;lea	bx,[_$P_FileSp_Char] 	; "[]|<>+=;\"" at
 26000                                  					; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1838h
 26001                                  	; 07/09/2023
 26002 00001BC5 BB[5F15]                	mov	bx,_$P_FileSp_Char
 26003 00001BC8 B90900                  	mov	cx,_$P_FileSp_Len ; 9	;AN000; load length of it
 26004                                  _$P_FileSp_Loop: 			;AN000;
 26005 00001BCB 2E3A07                  	cmp	al,[cs:bx]		;AN000; is it one of special character ?
 26006 00001BCE 7404                    	je	short _$P_FileSp_Exit	;AN000;
 26007                                  
 26008 00001BD0 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26009 00001BD1 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_FileSp_Loop		;AN000;
 26010                                  
 26011 00001BD3 41                      	inc	cx			;AN000; reset ZF
 26012                                  _$P_FileSp_Exit: 			;AN000;
 26013 00001BD4 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26014 00001BD5 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26015 00001BD6 C3                      	retn

 26022                                  ; _$P_Drive_Format;
 26023                                  ;
 26024                                  ; Function:  Check if the input string is valid drive only format.
 26025                                  ;	     And set the result buffer.
 26026                                  ;
 26027                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 26028                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 26029                                  ;
 26030                                  ; Output:    None
 26031                                  ;
 26032                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 26033                                  ;
 26034                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W)
 26035                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26036                                  
 26037                                  _$P_Drive_Format:
 26038 00001BD7 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26039 00001BD8 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26040 00001BD9 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000;

 26042 00001BDE 7436                    	je	short _$P_Drv_Exit	;AN000; do nothing
 26043

 26045 00001BE3 722A                    	jc	short _$P_Drv_Err	;AN000;
 26046                                  
 26047 00001BE5 2E837C013A              	cmp	word [cs:si+1],_$P_Colon ;AN000; "d", ":", 0  ?
 26048 00001BEA 740D                    	je	short _$P_DrvF00	;AN000;
 26049                                  
 26050                                  	;test	word [es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Match_Flag],_$P_Ig_Colon 
 26051                                  	;test	byte [es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Match_Flag],_$P_Ig_Colon ;AN000; colon can be ignored?
 26052                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26053 00001BEC 26F60710                	test	byte [es:bx],_$P_Ig_Colon
 26054                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)	
 26055                                  	;test	word [es:bx],_$P_Ig_Colon
 26056 00001BF0 741D                    	jz	short _$P_Drv_Err	;AN000;
 26057                                  
 26058 00001BF2 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; "d", 0  ?
 26059 00001BF7 7516                    	jne	short _$P_Drv_Err	;AN000;
 26060                                  
 26061                                  _$P_DrvF00:				;AN000;
 26062 00001BF9 0C20                    	or	al,_$P_Make_Lower	;AN000; lower case
 26063 00001BFB 3C61                    	cmp	al,"a"                  ;AN000; drive letter must
 26064 00001BFD 7210                    	jb	short _$P_Drv_Err	;AN000; in range of
 26065                                  
 26066 00001BFF 3C7A                    	cmp	al,"z"                  ;AN000; "a"-"z"
 26067 00001C01 770C                    	ja	short _$P_Drv_Err	;AN000; if no, error
 26068                                  
 26069 00001C03 2C60                    	sub	al,"a"-1                ;AN000; make text drive to binary drive
 26070 00001C05 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; set
 26071                                  	;mov	ah,_$P_No_Tag		;AN000; result
 26072                                  	;mov	al,_$P_Drive		;AN000; buffer
 26073                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26074 00001C07 B806FF                  	mov	ax,(_$P_No_Tag<<8)|_$P_Drive ; 0FF06h
 26075                                  					      ; set result buffer
 26076 00001C0A E86EFB                  	call	_$P_Fill_Result		;AN000; to drive
 26077 00001C0D EB07                    	jmp	short _$P_Drv_Exit	;AN000;
 26078                                  
 26079                                  _$P_Drv_Err:				;AN000;
 26080 00001C0F 2EC706[C514]0900        	mov	word [cs:_$P_RC],_$P_Syntax ;AC034;
 26081                                  _$P_Drv_Exit:				;AN000;
 26082 00001C16 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26083 00001C17 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26084 00001C18 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26088                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26089                                  ; _$P_Skip_Delim;
 26090                                  ;
 26091                                  ; Function: Skip delimiters specified in the PARMS list, white space
 26092                                  ;	    and comma.
 26093                                  ;
 26094                                  ; Input:    DS:SI -> Command String
 26095                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26096                                  ;

 26098                                  ;	    CY = 0 then SI move to 1st non-delimiter character
 26099                                  ;	    AL = Last examineed character

 26105

 26107                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26108 00001C19 AC                      	lodsb				;AN000;

 26110 00001C1D 7416                    	jz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_CY	;AN000; if yes, exit w/ CY on
 26111

 26113 00001C22 7514                    	jnz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_NCY ;AN000; if no, exit w/ CY off
 26114

 26116 00001C2A 74ED                    	jz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Loop ;AN000; if no, loop
 26117                                  
 26118 00001C2C 2EF606[D114]41          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW+_$P_equ ;AC034; /x , or xxx=zzz , (tm08)
 26119                                  	;jz	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; no switch, no keyword (tm08)
 26120                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26121                                  	; cf=0
 26122 00001C32 7505                    	jnz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 26123 00001C34 C3                      	retn
 26124                                  
 26125                                  	;dec	si			;AN000; backup si for next call (tm08)
 26126                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; else exit w/ CY off
 26127                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26128                                  	; cf=0
 26129                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26130                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 26131                                  
 26132                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_CY:			;AN000;
 26133 00001C35 F9                      	stc				;AN000; indicate EOL
 26134 00001C36 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 26139 00001C39 4E                      	dec	si			;AN000;  backup index pointer
 26140                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26141                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26142                                  ;_$P_Exit_At_Extra:	 ; cf=0
 26143 00001C3A C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26144

 26151                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 26152                                  ;
 26153                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 26154                                  ;
 26155                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26156                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List

 26169 00001C45 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?

 26171                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;

 26173                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 26174 00001C4E 721D                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 26175 00001C50 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 26176 00001C52 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 26177                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26178 00001C56 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 26179                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26180 00001C59 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; *

 26203                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26204                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26205                                  ;
 26206                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26207                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26208                                  ;	    blanks.
 26209                                  ;
 26210                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26211                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26212                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 26213                                  ;
 26214                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 26215                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 26216                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 26217                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26218                                  
 26219                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26220                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26221                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26222                                  
 26223                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26224 00001C70 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26225 00001C71 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26226 00001C72 2EC606[CB14]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 26227                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 26228                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 26229 00001C78 2E8026[D114]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 26230 00001C7E 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 26231 00001C80 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26232                                  
 26233 00001C82 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 26234 00001C84 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26235                                  
 26236 00001C86 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 26237 00001C88 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26238                                  
 26239                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26240                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26241                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26242                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26243                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26244                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26245                                  %if 0
 26246                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26247                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26248                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26249                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26250                                  
 26251                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26252                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26253                                  
 26254                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26255                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26256                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26257                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26258                                  %endif
 26259                                  
 26260                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 26261 00001C8A 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 26262                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26263 00001C8F 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26264                                  
 26265                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26266 00001C91 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26267                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26268 00001C93 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26269                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26270                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26271                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26272                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26273 00001C97 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 26274                                  
 26275 00001C99 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 26276                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26277 00001C9C 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26278 00001C9D 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 26279 00001CA0 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26280                                  
 26281 00001CA2 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 26282                                  
 26283                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 26284                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 26285                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26286                                  	; cx=0 here
 26287 00001CA4 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 26288                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 26289                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 26290 00001CA5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26291 00001CA6 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26292 00001CA7 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26293                                  
 26294                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 26295 00001CA8 2EA2[CB14]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 26296 00001CAC 2EF606[D114]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 26297 00001CB2 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 26298                                  
 26299 00001CB4 2E800E[D114]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 26300                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 26301                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 26302 00001CBA 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 26303 00001CBC EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 26305                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26306                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26307                                  ;
 26308                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26309                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26310                                  ;
 26311                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26312                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26313                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26314                                  ;
 26315                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26316                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26317                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26318                                  
 26319                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26320                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26321                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26322                                  ;
 26323                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26324                                  
 26325                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26326                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26327                                  
 26328                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26329                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26330                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26331                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26332 00001CBE BD[DA14]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26333                                  
 26334                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26335 00001CC1 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26336 00001CC3 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26337                                  
 26338                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26339 00001CC5 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26340 00001CC7 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26341                                  
 26342 00001CC9 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26343                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26344                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26345 00001CCA C3                      	retn
 26346                                  
 26347                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26348                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26349                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26350                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26351                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26352                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26353                                  
 26354                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26355                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26356 00001CCB 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26357 00001CCD 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26358                                  
 26359 00001CCF 2E800E[D114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26360                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26361                                  
 26362                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26363                                  	; cf=0
 26364                                  	;retn
 26365                                  
 26366                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26367                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26368                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26369 00001CD5 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26370                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26371                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26372 00001CD6 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26373                                  
 26374                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26375                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26376                                  ;
 26377                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26378                                  ;
 26379                                  ;  Input:
 26380                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26381                                  ;
 26382                                  ;  Output:
 26383                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26384                                  ;
 26385                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26386                                  ;
 26387                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26388                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26389                                  
 26390                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26391 00001CD7 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26392 00001CD8 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26393 00001CD9 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26394                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 26395                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 26396                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26397 00001CDA 2E8B36[CE14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 26398 00001CDF 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26399 00001CE1 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26400 00001CE3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26401 00001CE4 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26402 00001CE5 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26403 00001CE6 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26404 00001CE7 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26405 00001CE8 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26406 00001CE9 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26407                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26408                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 26409 00001CEA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 26410 00001CEC B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26411 00001CEF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26412                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26413 00001CF1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26414 00001CF3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26415 00001CF5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26416 00001CF6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26417 00001CF7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26418 00001CF8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26419 00001CF9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26420 00001CFA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26421 00001CFB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26422 00001CFC 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26423                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26424 00001CFE 2E8936[CC14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26425 00001D03 2E891E[CE14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26426                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26427                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26428                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26429                                  	; 08/07/2023

 26431                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26432 00001D0D 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26433 00001D10 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26434 00001D12 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26435 00001D14 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in

 26437 00001D19 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector

 26440                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;

 26442 00001D1F 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26443                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26444 00001D20 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26445                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;

 26476 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer

 26479                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation

 26483                                  .size:
 26484                                  endstruc

 26490 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 26491 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 26492                                  .size:
 26493                                  endstruc

 27019                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27020                                  
 27021                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27022                                  ;
 27023                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27024                                  ;
 27025                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27026                                  ;
 27027                                  ;   Modification log:
 27028                                  ;
 27029                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27030                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27031                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27032                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27033                                  ;
 27034                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27035                                  ;
 27036                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27037                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27038                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27039                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27040                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27041                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27042                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27043                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27044                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27045                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27046                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27047                                  ;
 27048                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27049                                  
 27050                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27051                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27052                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27053                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27054                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27055                                  
 27056                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27057                                  
 27058                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27059                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27060                                  
 27061                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27062                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27063                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27064                                  
 27065                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27066                                  ;
 27067                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27068                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27069                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 27070                                  ;	           line.
 27071                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27072                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27073                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27074                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27075                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27076                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27077                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 27078                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27079                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27080                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27081                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27082                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27083                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27084                                  ;	           for details).
 27085                                  
 27086 00001F25 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27087 00001F26 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27088 00001F27 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27089 00001F29 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27090 00001F2A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27091 00001F3A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27092 00001F5A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27093 00001F5B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27094 00001F5C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27095                                  
 27096                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27097                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27098                                  
 27099                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27100                                  
 27101                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27102

 27115 00001F61 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27116 00001F63 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 27117 00001F67 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver

 27124 00001F6F 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)

 27152                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
