 27154                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27155                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 27156                                  
 27157                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27158                                  ;
 27159                                  ; procedure : doconf
 27160                                  ;
 27161                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 27162                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 27163                                  ;
 27164                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27165                                  
 27166                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27167                                  doconf:
 27168 00001F91 0E                      	push	cs
 27169 00001F92 1F                      	pop	ds
 27170                                  
 27171 00001F93 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 27172                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 27173 00001F96 CD21                    	int	21h
 27174 00001F98 8816[3A46]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 27175                                  
 27176                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 27177                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27178                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27179                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 27180 00001F9C 8816[3846]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 27181                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27182                                  
 27183 00001FA0 BA[4F45]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 27184 00001FA3 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 27185                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 27186 00001FA6 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27187 00001FA7 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27188 00001FA9 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 27189                                  
 27190                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27191                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27192                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27193 00001FAB E8F418                  	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 27194                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 27195                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 27196 00001FAE C606[CD02]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 27197 00001FB3 C3                      	retn
 27198                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 27199 00001FB4 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 27200 00001FB6 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; 0
 27201 00001FB8 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; 0
 27202                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 27203 00001FBA B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 27204 00001FBD CD21                    	int	21h
 27205 00001FBF A3[5603]                	mov	[count],ax		; dx:ax = file size ; 08/09/2023
 27206                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 27207 00001FC2 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 27208                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 27209                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.
 27210                                  					; ((Also PCDOS 7.1 has 'xor dx,dx' here))
 27211                                  					; (Error will be same if CONGIG.SYS file
 27212                                  					;  size > 64KB) 
 27213                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 27214 00001FC4 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 27215 00001FC7 CD21                    	int	21h
 27216                                  
 27217                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 27218 00001FC9 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 27219                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27220                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 27221                                  
 27222 00001FCD A1[5603]                	mov	ax,[count]
 27223 00001FD0 A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 27224 00001FD3 E875F1                  	call	ParaRound
 27225 00001FD6 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27226                                  
 27227                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27228                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27229                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27230                                  ;
 27231                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27232                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27233                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27234                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27235                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27236                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27237                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27238                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27239                                  ;
 27240 00001FD8 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27241 00001FD9 8916[B614]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27242 00001FDD 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27243                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27244                                  
 27245 00001FDF 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 27246                                  	
 27247                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27248 00001FE2 8916[A502]              	mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 27249 00001FE6 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27250                                  	
 27251                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27252                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27253                                  	;call    TempCDS 
 27254                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27255                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27256                                  	; ds <> cs 
 27257                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 27258                                  
 27259                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27260                                  	; ds = cs
 27261 00001FEA 8B0E[5603]              	mov	cx,[count]
 27262                                  	
 27263 00001FEE 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27264 00001FF0 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27265                                  
 27266 00001FF2 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27267                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27268                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27269 00001FF4 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27270                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 27271 00001FF6 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27272 00001FF7 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27273 00001FF9 9C                      	pushf
 27274                                  
 27275                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 27276                                  
 27277 00001FFA 50                      	push	ax
 27278 00001FFB 57                      	push	di
 27279 00001FFC 51                      	push	cx
 27280 00001FFD B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 27281 00001FFF 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27282 00002001 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 27283 00002003 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 27284 00002005 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 27285                                  
 27286                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 27287                                  
 27288 00002007 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 27289                                  
 27290                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 27291                                  
 27292                                  puteol:
 27293 00002008 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 27294 0000200A AA                      	stosb
 27295 0000200B B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 27296 0000200D AA                      	stosb
 27297 0000200E 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 27298                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27299                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 27300                                  
 27301                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 27302                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27303 00002010 0E                      	push	cs
 27304 00002011 1F                      	pop	ds
 27305                                  
 27306 00002012 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count

 27410 00002078 E8B121                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27411 0000207B 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error

 27413 00002080 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next

 27416                                  ;
 27417                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27418                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27419                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27420                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27421                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27422                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27423                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27424                                  ;   spot.
 27425                                  ;
 27426                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27427                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27428                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27429                                  ;   retrieved.
 27430                                  ;

 27626                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27627                                  ; buffer command
 27628                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27629                                  
 27630                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27631                                  ;									      *
 27632                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27633                                  ;									      *
 27634                                  ; input :								      *
 27635                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27636                                  ; output:								      *
 27637                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27638                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27639                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27640                                  ;									      *
 27641                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27642                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27643                                  ; logic:								      *
 27644                                  ; {									      *
 27645                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27646                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27647                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27648                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27649                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27650                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27651                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27652                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27653                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27654                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27655                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27656                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27657                                  ;	};								      *
 27658                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27659                                  ; };									      *
 27660                                  ;									      *
 27661                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27662                                  
 27663                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27664                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 27665                                  tryb:
 27666 00002152 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 27667 00002155 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 27668                                  
 27669                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27670                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)
 27671                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27672                                  ;%if 0
 27673                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27674 00002157 E83F1F                  	call	query_user		; query the user if config_cmd
 27675 0000215A 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27676                                  ;endif
 27677                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27678                                  
 27679                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27680                                  	; 18/12/2022
 27681 0000215C 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27682                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 27683 0000215E 880E[6D1D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 27684                                  
 27685 00002162 BF[261D]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 27686                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 27687                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27688                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27689                                  do7:
 27690 00002165 E87C07                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27691 00002168 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 27692                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 27693                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 27694                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27695                                  ;sr7:
 27696                                  	;jmp	coff
 27697                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27698 0000216A E9A606                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27699                                  if7:
 27700 0000216D 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 27701 00002170 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 27702                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 27703 00002172 813E[711D][661D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 27704                                  	;jne	short if11
 27705                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27706 00002178 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11
 27707                                  
 27708                                  ;	mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],1 ; set the flag M016
 27709                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 27710                                  if11:
 27711                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 27712 0000217A A1[731D]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]

 27715

 27717                                  	;jmp	short en11
 27718                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27719 00002185 EBDE                    	jmp	short do7
 27720                                  if13:
 27721 00002187 A3[6B1D]                	mov	[p_h_buffers],ax
 27722                                  en11:
 27723 0000218A EBD9                    	jmp	short do7
 27724                                  en7:
 27725 0000218C 833E[691D]63            	cmp	word [p_buffers],99
 27726 00002191 760B                    	jbe	short if18
 27727                                  
 27728                                  ;	cmp	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; M016
 27729                                  ;	jne	short if18
 27730                                  
 27731 00002193 E87907                  	call	badparm_p
 27732 00002196 C706[6B1D]0000          	mov	word [p_h_buffers],0
 27733 0000219C EB12                    	jmp	short sr7
 27734                                  if18:
 27735 0000219E A1[691D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.
 27736 000021A1 A3[9902]                	mov	[buffers],ax	; now,let's set it really.
 27737                                  
 27738 000021A4 A1[6B1D]                	mov	ax,[p_h_buffers]
 27739 000021A7 A3[9B02]                	mov	[h_buffers],ax
 27740                                  
 27741                                  ;	mov	al,[p_buffer_slash_x]	; M016
 27742                                  ;	mov	[buffer_slash_x],al
 27743                                  
 27744 000021AA A1[AF02]                	mov	ax,[linecount]
 27745 000021AD A3[B902]                	mov	[buffer_linenum],ax ; save the line number for the future use.
 27746                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27747                                  	;jmp	short sr7
 27748                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27749                                  sr7:
 27750 000021B0 E9FCFE                  	jmp	coff

 27752                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27753                                  ; break command
 27754                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27755                                  
 27756                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27757                                  ;									    *
 27758                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27759                                  ;									    *
 27760                                  ; input :								    *
 27761                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27762                                  ; output:								    *
 27763                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27764                                  ;									    *
 27765                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27766                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27767                                  ; logic:								    *
 27768                                  ; {									    *
 27769                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27770                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27771                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27772                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27773                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *

 29167                                  ; files command
 29168                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29169                                  
 29170                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29171                                  ; function: parse the parameters of files= command.			      *
 29172                                  ;									      *
 29173                                  ; input :								      *
 29174                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 29175                                  ; output:								      *
 29176                                  ;	variable files set.						      *
 29177                                  ;									      *
 29178                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 29179                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 29180                                  ; logic:								      *
 29181                                  ; {									      *
 29182                                  ;	set di points to files_parms;					      *

 29365                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29366                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29367                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29368                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29369                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29370                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29371                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29372                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29373                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29374                                  
 29375                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29376                                  ;									  *
 29377                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29378                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29379                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29380                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29381                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29382                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29383                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29384                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29385                                  ; input :								  *
 29386                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29387                                  ; output:								  *
 29388                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29389                                  ;									  *
 29390                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29391                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29392                                  ; logic:								  *
 29393                                  ; {									  *
 29394                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29395                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29396                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29397                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29398                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29399                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29400                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29401                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29402                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29403                                  ;	     }								  *
 29404                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29405                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29406                                  ;	};								  *
 29407                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29408                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29409                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29410                                  ; };									  *
 29411                                  ;**************************************************************************

 30524                                  ;
 30525                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30526                                  ;
 30527                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30528                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30529                                  ;
 30530                                  ;	Output : none
 30531                                  ;
 30532                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30533                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30534                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30535                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30536                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30537                                  ;
 30538                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30539

 30541                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30542                                  	; ds = cs

 30545                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 30546 0000298C E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 30547 0000298F 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30548                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30549                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30550                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30551                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 30552                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30553                                  	; ds = cs
 30554 00002991 803E[7B1F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 30555 00002996 74F0                    	je	short limx
 30556 00002998 A1[611F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 30557                                  lim_set:
 30558                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30559                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30560                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 30561                                  ;limx:
 30562                                  	;retn
 30563                                  	
 30564                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem

 30566                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30567                                  ;
 30568                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30569                                  ;
 30570                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30571                                  ;	Output : none
 30572                                  ;
 30573                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30574                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30575                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30576                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30577                                  ;
 30578                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30579                                  
 30580                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30581                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30582 0000299B 1E                      	push	ds
 30583 0000299C BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30584 0000299F 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30585 000029A1 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30586 000029A5 2E891E[7F1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30587 000029AA B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30588 000029AC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30589 000029AE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30590 000029B1 2EC606[7E1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30591 000029B7 1F                      	pop	ds
 30592                                  ;limx:
 30593 000029B8 C3                      	retn
 30594                                  
 30595                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30596                                  ;
 30597                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30598                                  ;
 30599                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30600                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30601                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30602                                  ;
 30603                                  ;	Output : none
 30604                                  ;
 30605                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 30606                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30607                                  ;
 30608                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30609                                  
 30610                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 30611                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30612                                  	; ds = cs
 30613 000029B9 803E[7E1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30614                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 30615                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30616                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30617 000029BE 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30618                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30619 000029C0 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30620 000029C3 8826[7E1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30621                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30622                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30623 000029C7 1E                      	push	ds
 30624                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30625 000029C8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30626 000029CA 2EA1[7F1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 30627 000029CE A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 30628 000029D1 1F                      	pop	ds
 30629                                  timx:
 30630 000029D2 C3                      	retn

 30686                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30687                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30688                                  
 30689                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30690                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30691                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30692                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30693                                  
 30694                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30695                                  ;
 30696                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30697                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30698                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30699                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30700                                  ;
 30701                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30702                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30703                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30704                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30705                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30706                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30707                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30708                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30709                                  ; available during the load.
 30710                                  ;
 30711                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30712                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30713                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30714                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30715                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30716                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30717                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30718                                  ;
 30719                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30720                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30721                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30722                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30723                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30724                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30725                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30726                                  ;
 30727                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30728                                  
 30729                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30730                                  
 30731                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30732                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30733                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30734                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30735                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30736                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30737                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30738                                  
 30739                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30740                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30741                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30742                                  
 30743                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30744                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30745                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30746                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30747                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30748                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30749                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30750                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30751                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30752                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30753                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30754                                  
 30755                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30756                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30757                                  
 30758                                  InitVar:
 30759                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30760                                  	; ds = cs
 30761                                  
 30762                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30763                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30764                                  	;push	ax
 30765                                  	;push	cx
 30766                                  	;push	di
 30767 000029FD 06                      	push	es
 30768                                  
 30769                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30770 000029FE 0E                      	push	cs
 30771 000029FF 07                      	pop	es
 30772                                  
 30773 00002A00 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30774                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30775                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30776                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30777                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30778                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30779                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30780                                  
 30781                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30782                                  	; ds = cs
 30783 00002A02 A2[261F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30784 00002A05 A2[251F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30785 00002A08 A3[271F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30786 00002A0B C606[291F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30787                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30788 00002A10 A2[5C1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30789                                  
 30790 00002A13 FC                      	cld
 30791                                  
 30792 00002A14 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30793 00002A17 BF[2A1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30794 00002A1A F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30795                                  
 30796                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 30797                                  	; 01/01/2033
 30798 00002A1C B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 30799 00002A1E BF[3A1F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30800 00002A21 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30801                                  
 30802                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30803                                  
 30804                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30805 00002A23 07                      	pop	es
 30806                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30807                                  	;pop	di
 30808                                  	;pop	cx
 30809                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 30810                                  
 30811 00002A24 C3                      	retn
 30812                                  
 30813                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30814                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30815                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30816                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30817                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30818                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30819                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30820                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30821                                  
 30822                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30823                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30824                                  FixMem:
 30825                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30826                                  	;push	ax
 30827                                  	;push	bx
 30828                                  	;push	cx
 30829                                  	;push	dx
 30830 00002A25 06                      	push	es
 30831                                  
 30832 00002A26 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30833                                  
 30834 00002A29 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30835 00002A2C 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30836                                  
 30837 00002A2E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30838                                  
 30839                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30840                                  
 30841 00002A30 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30842 00002A32 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30843 00002A34 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30844                                  
 30845                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30846                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30847                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30848                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30849                                  
 30850 00002A35 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30851 00002A39 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30852 00002A3E 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30853 00002A40 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30854                                  
 30855                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30856                                  
 30857 00002A42 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30858 00002A47 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30859 00002A49 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30860                                  
 30861 00002A4D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30862                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30863                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30864 00002A52 43                      	inc	bx
 30865 00002A53 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30866                                  
 30867                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30868                                  
 30869 00002A58 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 30870 00002A5A 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30871                                  
 30872 00002A5F 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30873 00002A61 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30874 00002A66 43                      	inc	bx
 30875 00002A67 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30876                                  
 30877                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30878 00002A69 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30879 00002A6B 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30880                                  fmX:	
 30881 00002A6D E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30882                                  
 30883 00002A70 07                      	pop	es
 30884                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30885                                  	;pop	dx
 30886                                  	;pop	cx
 30887                                  	;pop	bx
 30888                                  	;pop	ax
 30889                                  
 30890 00002A71 C3                      	retn
 30891                                  
 30892                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30893                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30894                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30895                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30896                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30897                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30898                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30899                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30900                                  
 30901                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30902                                  fm_link:
 30903 00002A72 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30904 00002A75 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30905                                  
 30906                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30907                                  	;
 30908                                  	;push	es
 30909                                  	;push	cs
 30910                                  	;pop	es
 30911                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30912                                  	;pop	es
 30913                                  	
 30914                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30915                                  	; ds = cs
 30916                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30917 00002A77 A2[5A1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 30918                                  
 30919 00002A7A B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30920 00002A7D BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 30921 00002A80 CD21                    	int	21h
 30922 00002A82 C3                      	retn
 30923                                  
 30924                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30925                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30926                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30927                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30928                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30929                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30930                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30931                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30932                                  
 30933                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30934                                  fm_unlink:
 30935 00002A83 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30936                                  	
 30937                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30938                                  	;
 30939                                  	;push	ds
 30940                                  	;push	cs
 30941                                  	;pop	ds
 30942                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30943                                  	;pop	ds
 30944                                  	
 30945                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30946                                  	; ds = cs
 30947                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30948 00002A85 8A1E[5A1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 30949                                  
 30950 00002A89 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30951 00002A8C CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30952 00002A8E C3                      	retn
 30953                                  
 30954                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30955                                  
 30956                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30957                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30958                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30959                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30960                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30961                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30962                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30963                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30964                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30965                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30966                                  ;
 30967                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30968                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30969                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30970                                  ;
 30971                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30972                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30973                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30974                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30975                                  ;
 30976                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30977                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30978                                  ;
 30979                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30980                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30981                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30982                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30983                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30984                                  ;     lh
 30985                                  ;     /l
 30986                                  ;     1
 30987                                  ;     1000
 30988                                  ;     2
 30989                                  ;     print
 30990                                  ;     /d
 30991                                  ;     :lpt2
 30992                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30993                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30994                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30995                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30996                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30997                                  ; for:
 30998                                  ;    Each /L
 30999                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 31000                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 31001                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31002                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31003                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31004                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31005                                  
 31006                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31007                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31008                                  
 31009                                  ParseVar:
 31010                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31011                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31012                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31013 00002A8F 1E                      	push	ds
 31014 00002A90 06                      	push	es
 31015                                  
 31016 00002A91 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31017 00002A92 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31018 00002A93 FC                      	cld
 31019                                  
 31020                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31021                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31022                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31023                                  
 31024 00002A94 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31025 00002A95 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31026 00002A98 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31027                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31028 00002A9A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31029 00002A9C 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31030                                  
 31031 00002A9E 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31032 00002A9F F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31033 00002AA0 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31034                                  
 31035 00002AA2 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31036                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31037 00002AA3 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31038                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 31039 00002AA5 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 31040 00002AA7 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 31041                                  
 31042                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31043 00002AA9 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31044                                  
 31045                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 31046                                  	;
 31047                                  	;push	es
 31048                                  	;push	cs
 31049                                  	;pop	es
 31050                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 31051                                  	;pop	es
 31052                                  
 31053 00002AAE 2EC606[261F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 31054                                  
 31055 00002AB4 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 31056                                  
 31057                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 31058 00002AB6 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 31059 00002AB8 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 31060                                  
 31061                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31062 00002ABA 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31063                                  
 31064 00002ABF E80E00                  	call	parseL
 31065 00002AC2 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 31066                                  
 31067 00002AC4 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 31068 00002AC5 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 31069                                  
 31070                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 31071 00002AC7 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31072 00002ACA 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 31073 00002ACB 4E                      	dec	si
 31074 00002ACC F9                      	stc
 31075                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 31076 00002ACD 07                      	pop	es
 31077 00002ACE 1F                      	pop	ds
 31078                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31079                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31080 00002ACF C3                      	retn
 31081                                  
 31082                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31083                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31084                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31085                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31086                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31087                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31088                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31089                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31090                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31091                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31092                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 31093                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31094                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31095                                  
 31096                                  parseL:
 31097 00002AD0 AC                      	lodsb
 31098 00002AD1 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31099 00002AD3 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31100                                  
 31101                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31102                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31103                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31104                                  
 31105 00002AD5 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31106 00002AD8 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31107 00002ADA E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31108                                  
 31109 00002ADD 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 31110 00002ADF E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31111 00002AE2 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31112                                  
 31113                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31114 00002AE4 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31115                                  
 31116 00002AE9 AC                      	lodsb
 31117 00002AEA 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31118 00002AEC 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31119                                  
 31120 00002AEE E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31121 00002AF1 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31122                                  
 31123 00002AF3 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31124 00002AF6 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31125                                  
 31126                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31127 00002AF8 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31128 00002AFA 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31129                                  
 31130 00002AFC 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31131 00002AFE 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31132                                  
 31133                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31134                                  
 31135 00002B00 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31136 00002B03 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31137                                  
 31138 00002B05 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 31139                                  
 31140 00002B08 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 31141                                  
 31142                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31143 00002B0B 2EFE06[5C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31144                                  
 31145 00002B10 AC                      	lodsb
 31146 00002B11 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31147 00002B13 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31148                                  
 31149 00002B15 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31150 00002B18 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31151                                  
 31152 00002B1A E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31153 00002B1D 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31154                                  
 31155                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31156 00002B1F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31157 00002B21 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31158                                  plE1:	
 31159                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31160 00002B23 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31161 00002B26 4E                      	dec	si
 31162 00002B27 F9                      	stc
 31163 00002B28 C3                      	retn
 31164                                  
 31165                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 31166 00002B29 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice

 31205                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31206                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31207                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31208                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31209                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31210                                  ; USES:     ZF
 31211                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31212                                  
 31213                                  isEOL:

 31215 00002B31 7406                    	je	short ieX
 31216 00002B33 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 31217 00002B35 7402                    	je	short ieX
 31218 00002B37 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 31219                                  ieX:	
 31220 00002B39 C3                      	retn

 31224                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31225                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 31226                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 31227                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31228                                  ; USES:     ZF

 31230                                  
 31231                                  isWhite:

 31233 00002B3C 7406                    	je	short iwX
 31234 00002B3E 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 31235 00002B40 7402                    	je	short iwX
 31236 00002B42 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 31237                                  iwX:	
 31238 00002B44 C3                      	retn

 31291                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31292                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31293                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31294                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31295                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31296                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31297                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31298                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31299                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31300                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31301                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31302                                  
 31303                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31304                                  stowUMB:
 31305 00002B58 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 31306 00002B5A 7202                    	jb	short su10
 31307 00002B5C F9                      	stc
 31308 00002B5D C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 31309                                  su10:	
 31310                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31311                                  	;push	bx
 31312                                  	;push	di
 31313                                  	;push	si
 31314                                  	;push	ds
 31315                                  	;push	es
 31316                                  	;push	cs
 31317                                  	;pop	es
 31318                                  	;push	cs
 31319                                  	;pop	ds
 31320                                  
 31321                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31322                                  	; ds <> cs
 31323                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 31324 00002B5E 2E803E[291F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 31325                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 31326 00002B64 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31327 00002B66 2EA2[291F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31328                                  
 31329                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31330                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 31331                                  	;jne	short su20
 31332                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31333                                  su20:	
 31334 00002B6A 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 31335 00002B6C 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 31336                                  
 31337                                  	;mov	bl,al
 31338                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 31339                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 31340                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31341 00002B6E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 31342 00002B70 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 31343 00002B72 B001                    	mov	al,1
 31344                                  
 31345                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31346                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31347 00002B74 2E8687[2A1F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31348                                  
 31349                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 31350                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 31351                                  	;
 31352                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 31353                                  	
 31354                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31355 00002B79 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 31356 00002B7B F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 31357                                  su30:	
 31358                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31359                                  	;pop	es
 31360                                  	;pop	ds
 31361                                  	;pop	si
 31362                                  	;pop	di
 31363                                  	;pop	bx
 31364 00002B7C C3                      	retn
